Verse: Wishing the destruction (or annihilation) of a people, God lets adultery prevail among them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3171.

Verse: Wishing to create something, nothing can stop Him doing so.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3172.

Verse: Wishing to put His decrees to practice, the Exalted God makes the learned person's wisdom vanish (for a while) and subjects them to His will, and when this is accomplished, He gives their intellects back to them and regretful they turn.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3173.

Verse: Mendacity of tongue is one of the greatest sins.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1310; Page No. 186

Verse: Most people face loss in two blessings: good health and peace of mind.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1329; Page No. 189

Verse: Mention not (the names of) three persons: a man who has kept distance with people disobeyed his leader and died in that disobedience, a slave (man or woman) who has escaped from his master and died thereof, and a woman whose absent husband pays her expenses, but beautifies herself (for others) in his absence.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1311; Page No. 187

Verse: Mentioning God's blessings is thankfulness (to Him) and abandoning it is ungratefulness, and whoever is ungrateful to little will be as such to great (blessings), and whoever is thankless to people is thankless to God. Unity brings good and discord, agony.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1312; Page No. 187

Verse: Might does not lie in fight(wrestling), but in keeping cool when wrathful.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1313; Page No. 187

Verse: Mind your mother, your mother, your mother, then mind your father and then, your close relatives.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1314; Page No. 187

Verse: Mind! everyone of you has a greater liking for the wealth she (he) inherits than for that of his (her) own. Your wealth is what you send forth, and your heir's wealth is what you leave behind.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1315; Page No. 187

Verse: Mind! patience is coupled with victory, pain with relief and hardship with ease.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1316; Page No. 187

Verse: Mind! the pen of fate has recorded all possible things.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1317; Page No. 188

Verse: Mind! What has occurred to you was destined to occur to you, and what has not, was not.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1318; Page No. 188

Verse: Mind, people cannot grant you anything if God does not wish so, and they cannot spare you anything if God wishes the reverse. Thus, offer your requests to God and ask Him for help.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1319; Page No. 188

Verse: Misers will not be allowed to Paradise.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1320; Page No. 188

Verse: Moderateness in living (livelihood) shows man's deep knowledge.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1321; Page No. 188

Verse: Moderateness in spending (money) is on half of sustenance, friendship with people is one half of wisdom and asking questions properly is one half of knowledge.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1322; Page No. 188

Verse: Moderateness in spending (money) is one half of sustenance and good-temperedness, one half of faith.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1323; Page No. 188

Verse: Moderateness is beneficial to any household upon which it is bestowed.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1324; Page No. 188

Verse: Moderateness stands at the peak of one's intellect, and the benevolent of the world will be the benevolent of the Hereafter.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1325; Page No. 188&189

Verse: Moderation to people is (an act of) charity.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1326; Page No. 189

Verse: Modesty and good-temperedness form the basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1327; Page No. 189

Verse: Mosques are the homes of all the virtuous.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1328; Page No. 189

Verse: Move in the early morning to seek your sustenance and settle your needs, for early rising brings felicity and blessing.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1331; Page No. 189

Verse: Moving in the way of God in early morning or at night is better than the world and whatever belongs to it, the ark of the bow of anyone of you and his footprint in Paradise are better than the world and whatever belongs to it. If a woman among heavenly women moves toward the earth, she will fill up the distance between heavens and the earth with her pleasant perfume, and her veil is better than the world and whatever belongs to it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1332; Page No. 189

Verse: Muslims are a unified hand against others.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1333; Page No. 190

Verse: Muslims are bound to their promises as long as they agree with truth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1334; Page No. 190

Verse: Muslims are brothers (in faith).None is superior to others save for piety.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1335; Page No. 190

Verse: Muslims are mirrors of one another.When one of them sees something good in the mirror, (s)he acts upon it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1336; Page No. 190

Verse: "Allah will forgive one who repents to Him. The parts of his body and the earth will be ordered to hide his sins. The angels who note down the deeds of a person will be made to forget the sins."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 232

Verse: "One who repents a year before his death, Allah will forgive him." Then he said, "A year is too much; Allah will forgive even one who repents a month before his death." Then he said, "A month is also too much, Allah will forgive even one who repents a day before his death. Then he said, "A day is also too much, Allah will forgive even one who repents just a moment before death."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 232

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Allah gives abundant sustenance to whomsoever He desires. Similarly the mercy of Allah is spread far and wide for the sinners day and night waiting for the person to repent and be forgiven. The mercy of Allah waits at sunset for the people who committed sins during the day to repent and get themselves forgiven."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 232

Verse: "One who inscribes: Maashaa Allaahu laa quwwata illaa billaahi astaghfirullaah on his ring, will remain safe from devastating poverty."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 233

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) asked one of his companions, "Are there any fruits in the market which you like and desire to have?" "Yes," said he. Imam (a.s.) said, "If you see a thing, which is beyond your capacity to buy, be patient and you will get a reward for it."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 233

Verse: It is narrated that Umme Salma asked the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.), "May my parents be sacrificed on you, a woman married another man after her husband died. Now that both of them are dead and will enter Paradise so with whom will this woman live in Paradise?" "The woman will live with one who had a better character and behavior with the people around him. O Umme Salma! Good character grants good rewards in this world and the hereafter."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 233

Verse: There is no creature of Allah which has a good character and Allah does not feel ashamed to make his flesh a morsel of Hell.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 233

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his predecessors that Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said, "It is the habit of jurists and wise people to advise about three things in their every letter written to each other. Nothing else was present among them; that is one who is only worried about the hereafter, Allah will fulfill his worldly wishes and needs. Allah improves the exterior of one who improves his interior and one who develops good between himself and Allah, Allah develops good between him and the people."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 234

Verse: One who resists his own self instead of people, will get protection against the fear of the Day of Judgment.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 234

Verse: "If Allah has given His slave great bounties then if he praises Allah for those bounties this praise is better and heavier than that bounty."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 234

Verse: "One who thanks Allah after having food is like a person who has fasted. One who thanks Allah for a thing which He has not granted him, he will get the reward of patient ones."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 234

Verse: "A person who does good in the world is like a person who does good in the hereafter." Someone asked, "O Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.)! How is it possible?" He replied, "He will be forgiven by the mercy of Allah. His good deeds will be given to other people also and they will be made to enter Paradise. Hence he will be doing good in the world as well as the hereafter."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 235

Verse: A person asked the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.), "Teach me a deed which makes me beloved for Allah in the heaven and people on the earth." The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Remain attached to Divine things so that Allah loves you and remain aloof from what people have so that they love you."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 235

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) narrates from his father, who in turn narrates that Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) said,"The salvation of a believer lies in safeguarding his tongue and Amirul Momineen (a.s.) also said that one who safeguards his tongue, Allah will keep his defects hidden."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 235

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "O Ali (a.s.)! The Almighty Allah has kept poverty among His creatures as a trust. One who keeps it hidden will be like one who stays awake at night for Allah and observes fast. One who reveals his poverty in front of a person who can fulfill his desire but does not do so, such a person has killed that poor man. This person is not killed by a sword or a lance but by a wound on his heart."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 235/236

Verse: Almighty Allah will order a caller on the Day of Judgment to call out for the poor ones. Some people will stand up and they will be ordered to go to Paradise. When they reach the door of Paradise, they will be asked, "Do you want to go to Paradise even before accounting of deeds?" They will reply, "Were we given something whose account we should give?" Almighty Allah will say, "My servants! You are right. I didn't give you poverty to disgrace you but for this day. Go among the people and see. Whoever did good to you, hold his hand and make him enter Paradise along with you.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 236

Verse: "Having fever for a night compensates for sins of a year because its pain remains in the body for a year."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246

Verse: If I were to command anyone to prostrate anyone else, I would command women to prostrate their husbands.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 994, Page No. 140

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "O poor ones! Be happy. Allah's pleasure is granted to your hearts. Allah will pay the price of your poverty. If you had not been poor there was no reward for you."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 236

Verse: May Allah shower mercy on His virtuous and pious servant who did not beg inspite of difficulties even though he was troubled in this world and his desires were not fulfilled.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 236

Verse: The reward of shaking hands with each other is equal to the reward of a soldier in the way of Allah.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his predecessors that Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said, "One who utters the name of Allah before meals will never be questioned about that bounty of Allah."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: "The Almighty Allah will reward with a river in Paradise one who feeds a hungry person."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: "Paradise is made obligatory for one who feeds a hungry person."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: "One who enjoys tasting water in the world, Allah will make him enjoy pure wine in Paradise."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: "My father was having less money and had more expenses then too he used to give Sadaqah every Friday. He used to say that the reward of Sadaqah on Friday is two-fold, for Friday is better than all other days."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 237

Verse: "One who helps his brother who is thirsty and sorrowful, solves his problem and helps in fulfilling his desires the former will be granted seventy-two bounties, which will keep him safe from fear on the Day of Judgment."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 238

Verse: "The excellence of a man near Allah is in loving his brother. Allah has put the love of brothers in his heart. Allah loves him and will grant him full reward on the Day of Judgment."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 238

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his predecessors, who narrate from Amirul Momineen (a.s.), who narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "If someone fulfils a desire of a person with whom Allah is pleased the former will not go from this world till his own desire is fulfilled."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 238

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "If an animal travels for Hajj five times, it is like a camel of Paradise."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 245

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Fever is a spy of death and a prison of Allah on earth. High fever is from Hell and a part of fire for the believer."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246

Verse: "Fever is a good disease. It gives a part of suffering to each and every part of body. Not getting involved in it has no good."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246

Verse: "If a believer has fever once, his sins are destroyed like dry leaves fall off in the wind. His cries on his bed are like Tasbih and moans like praising Allah. His turning left and right is like fighting with sword in the way of Allah. If he worships Allah along with his brothers and friends, he will be forgiven. If he repents, he is indeed fortunate and if he breaks repentance, he is ill-fated. Any way, we prefer his well being and salvation."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246

Verse: "Having fever for a night compensates for past and future sins."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246

Verse: "One who thanks Allah after bearing illness for a night, is compensated for his sins of sixty years." The narrator asked the meaning of bearing. Imam (a.s.) replied, "Remaining patient during illness."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 246/247

Verse: "Illness purifies a believer. It is a mercy for him and a chain and curse for an infidel. A believer remains ill till the time his sins are forgiven."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 247

Verse: "Having headache for a night wipes all but greater sins of a person."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 247

Verse: Imam Musa Kazim (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said,"There are four rewards for a sick - the pen of difficulty is taken off from him, Allah orders angels to write those deeds of a sick again, which he used to perform in good health, illness goes into the parts of his body and takes out all the sins, if he passes away from this world, he will be forgiven and if he remains alive, then too he will be forgiven."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 247

Verse: "One who visits a sick for the sake of Allah, the prayer of sick for the visitor is accepted."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 247

Verse: "The illness of a child is compensation of the sins of parents."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 247

Verse: Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) narrates that Musa (a.s.) asked Allah, "Let me know the reward of visiting a sick." Allah replied, Allah replied, "I order an angel to worship in the grave of the visitor till the Day of Reckoning." Musa (a.s.) asked, "O Lord! What is the reward of giving ritual bath to a dead body?" Allah replied, "I will wash his sins like that of the day when he was born." Musa (a.s.) asked, "O Allah! What is the reward of those who attend a funeral?" I will appoint flag-bearing angels to attend him from his grave till the Day of Reckoning." Musa (a.s.) asked, "What is the reward of condoling a woman whose son has passed away?" Allah answered, "He will get the shade on the day when there will be no shade."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 248

Verse: It is narrated by Imam Zainul Abideen (a.s.) that his father narrated that Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) visited a person from the children of Abdul Muttalib who was on his death bed and was not facing the Qibla. The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) ordered him to turn his face towards qiblah and said, "If you turn his face towards qiblah, angels and God look at him till his soul is captured."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 248

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Do Talqeen of 'there is no god except Allah', for a person whose last words are, 'there is no god except Allah', will enter Paradise."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 248/249

Verse: "If a believer gives ghusl to a dead believer and recites: Allaahumma haadhaa badanu a'bdikal mu-mini wa qad akharajta rooh'ahu minhu wa farraqta bainahumaa fa-a'fwaka a'fwak Allah forgives the sins committed by him in one year except for the greater sins."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 249

Verse: "One who gives ghusl to a body of a believer and remain trustworthy with him, Allah will forgive all his sins." Someone asked, "How should one be trustworthy?" Imam (a.s.) answered, "One should not tell to others what he sees on the body."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 249

Verse: Bad-temperedness spoils one's deeds just as vinegar acetifies honey.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 259; Page No. 42

Verse: "If a few children of a person die and if he/she hopes for reward in turn those children will act as a shield in front of the fire of Hell for that person."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 249

Verse: "If three children of a person die before reaching puberty or if three children of a woman pass away from this world, these children will act as a shield in front of the fire of Hell for that person."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 249

Verse: "If three children pass away from the world, Allah will make the parents enter Paradise with His grace and mercy."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250

Verse: "If a child of a person passes away from this world, he/she is better than seventy children who are alive and that child will see Imam-e-Zamana."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250

Verse: "One who shoulders the coffin of a person, Allah will forgive his twenty-five greater sins and one who shoulders the coffin from all four sides, Allah will purify him of his sins."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250

Verse: "Arrange for a good burial shroud for the dead among you and shroud them well for the shroud is the only embellishment for them."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that Amirul Momineen narrated that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "The squeeze of grave for a believer is the atonement for the bounties wasted by him."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250

Verse: "If a blind person hopes for reward from Allah for his blindness and is a lover of Ahle Bayt (a.s.), none of his sins will remain when he meets Allah."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 250/251

Verse: "If a believer faces a calamity in this world and utters Laa ilaaha illallaah, Allah will forgive all of his sins except the greater sins for which the punishment of Hell is obligatory. Utter Laa ilaaha illallaah and glorify Allah whenever you are faced with a calamity in future. In this case Allah will forgive all the sins committed between two utterances (of the above phrase) except greater sins."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 251

Verse: "When a person gets the inspiration of uttering Laa ilaaha illallaah at the time of calamity, Paradise becomes obligatory on him."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 251

Verse: "One who recites Fa sub-h'aanallaahi h'eena tumsoona wa h'eena tus'bih'oona wa lahul h'amdu fis samaawaati wal arz"i wa a'shiyyanw wa h'eena tuz'hiroon thrice at night has received all the rewards of that night and distanced all the mischief. One who recites it in the morning will receive all the good and kept away from all the mischief of that day."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 217

Verse: "One who does not feel shy in earning his sustenance and meets his expenses is prosperous and has a good family. One who observes piety in the world, Allah fills his heart with wisdom, makes his tongue speak, keeps him away from worldly defects, diseases and their treatments and takes him to the 'abode of peace' (Daarus Salaam) safe and sound."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 217

Verse: Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Surely an angel descends carrying a scroll in the beginning of day and night and writes the deeds of men. Hence one should do good deeds in the beginning of day and night. God willing, you will be forgiven during the other times also if Allah wills, because Allah, the Mighty and Sublime says: 'Therefore remember Me, I will remember you' [Surah Baqarah 2:152]. And He says: 'and certainly the remembrance of Allah is the greatest'.[Surah Ankaboot 29:45]"
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 217/218

Verse: If one of you happens to see something interesting in himself, in his own property or in that of his brother (in faith), he should ask God for His blessings, for the evil of eyes is a reality.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1003; Page No. 141&142

Verse: If patience were a man, it would be a generous one.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1004; Page No. 142

Verse: If people knew what I know of loneliness, no one would ever ride(travel) alone at night.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1005; Page No. 142

Verse: If people were asked not to break the anciculan dung of camels, they would break it, saying, "They have asked us not to do so to spare us its benefits."
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 1006, Page No. 142

Verse: If somebody slanders you with regard to what he knows of you, you should refrain from so doing with respect to what you know of him. Thus, you will be rewarded, and he will be punished (by God).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1007; Page No. 142

Verse: If someone has a piece of advice for his brother (in faith), he should mention it to him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1008; Page No. 142

Verse: If son of Adam had a valley of gold, he would long for a second one, and if he had two valleys as such, he would long for a third, for his belly(hunger) will not be satiated save by soil, and God will accept the repentance of whoever He wishes.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1009; Page No. 142

Verse: If son of Adam had a valley of palms, he would long for the like of it to an unbounded extent, for his belly(hunger) will not be satiated save by soil.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1010; Page No. 142&143

Verse: "One who supports the murder of a believer by speaking a few words, will appear on the Day of Judgment having a forehead on which it will be written: This person is deprived of Divine mercy."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 344

Verse: While accounting of deeds will be going on, a person will come forward and soak another person in blood. He will be asked the reason for doing so. He will reply, "On so and so day he had spoken a few words due to which I was murdered."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 345

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq was asked, "What is the punishment of murder?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Hell."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 345

Verse: The narrator asked Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) that Allah, the Mighty and Sublime has said: For this reason did We prescribe to the children of Israel that whoever slays a soul, unless it be for manslaughter or for mischief in the land, it is as though he slew all men.[Surah Maidah 5:32] He has killed but one? Imam (a.s.) replied, "He will be kept in a place in Hell where there will be severe chastisement and if he kills everyone, too he will be kept in this place." The narrator asked, "What is the punishment if he murders again?" He replied, "His punishment is doubled."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 345

Verse: "The Almighty Allah will account for the deeds of the murderers first on the Day of Judgment. He will gather all murderers and the victims. Every victim will stand near his/her murderer with a bleeding face. He will tell Allah: This person had murdered me. Allah will ask the murderer: Did you murder him? And the person will not be able to hide anything from Him."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 345..

Verse: The murderer of a believer will have the option to die as a Jew, Christian or as a Magian (he will not die a Muslim).
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346

Verse: "A murder victim is not good or bad. He will be brought on the Judgment Day holding his killer by his collar with the right hand and holding his severed head in the left with blood dripping from it. He will say: O Lord! Ask him why he had murdered me? Thus if he had killed on the order of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, Allah will take the murderer to Paradise and the person to Hell but if he had killed him on the order of someone else, he would be told, 'Kill him like he killed you.' Then Allah will deal with them as He likes."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346

Verse: "Even that woman will be punished severely who had left a goat tied in sun and it died of thirst."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346

Verse: "A person most unjust in Allah's eyes is one who kills a person who hasn't murdered him or hurt one who did not hurt him."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346

Verse: It is narrated that Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) said that the Almighty Allah revealed onto Prophet Musa (a.s.),"Keep away from murdering a human being unlawfully. If one of you murders someone, he will be murdered a hundred thousand times in Hell in the same way as he had murdered his victim."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346

Verse: "One who murders someone, the Almighty Allah will write all the sins of the victim in the name of his murderer and cleanse the victim. This is described the verse: Surely I wish that you should bear the sin committed against me and your own sin, and so you would be of the inmates of the fire." [Surah Maidah 5:29]
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 346/347

Verse: God is kind to whoever has a kind heart.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 718; Page No. 103

Verse: God is not Merciful to the merciless.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 719; Page No. 103

Verse: It is narrated that Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) or Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) relates that A person asked the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.), "A dead body is lying in Jahina mosque." The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) got up immediately and hurried to that mosque on foot. All those who met him on the way joined them. Upon reaching there, the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) asked about the murderer of that person. People said, "The murderer is unknown." The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "This is the body of a Muslim lying among Muslims and you don't know its murderer? I swear by that Allah who made me an apostle if all the creatures of the heaven and earth are involved in the murder of a Muslim or are pleased with it, Allah will throw them headlong into Hell fire." Or he said, "He would toss them on their faces."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 347

Verse: Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Do not be surprised with a person who murders excessively because his killer is with Allah who will never die."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 347

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "The Almighty Allah has cursed the one who causes something and one who hides him." I asked: Who is that? He replied: One who kills."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 347/348

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that One who recites the Holy Quran for making money, will have no flesh on his face when he comes on the Day of Judgment.
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 348

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that One who mixes one part of the Holy Quran with another, is a disbeliever.
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 348

Verse: Shall I inform you of the worst of Allah's servants? It is the rude and arrogant person. And shall I inform you of the best of Allah's servants? It is the weak, abased person {al-mustaz`aafin: people who are abased, deemed weak, or downtrodden by others. People who are spiritually 'weak' are those who are unable or exempt from carrying out religious obligations due to mental or physical incapacity (ed.)}
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5944; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 66

Verse: Assist me in seeking out the weak people, for verily you are given sustenance and succour only because of the presence of the weak among you.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 6019; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 67

Verse: Allah, most High, will say: "O My servants who have fought for My sake, were killed and hurt for My sake, and have struggled for My sake! Enter Paradise!" And they will enter it without punishment or account.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 16635; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 73

Verse: God helps a judge as long as he keeps away from tyranny, but as soon as he starts cruelty, He leaves him on his own and Satan joins with him thereof.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 714; Page No. 103

Verse: God helps His servants as long as they help their brothers (in faith).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 715; Page No. 103

Verse: God in the Day of Judgment will terrify whoever casts an awful look at a Muslim, terrifying him unfoundedly.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 716; Page No. 103

Verse: God is (the real) physician. What's good for you is perchance bad for other than you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 717; Page No. 103

Verse: God relieves the one who often asks Him forgiveness from all griefs, provides him with a refuge in all difficulties, and gives him sustenance from an unexpected source.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 732; Page No. 105

Verse: God secures the sustenance of those who seek knowledge.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 733; Page No. 105

Verse: God taught me courtesy and how nice was it (to me)!
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 734; Page No. 105

Verse: God will abase whoever seeks honor through His servants.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 735; Page No. 105

Verse: God will assist anyone who intents to pay back his debts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 736; Page No. 105

Verse: God will banish Paradise for the one who dies after having deceived his servants whom God have put under his supervision.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 737; Page No. 106

Verse: God will be pleased with whoever seeks His consent, even if it leads to people's anger, and will be angry about whoever seeks people's consent by making Him displeased.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 738; Page No. 106

Verse: God will build a house in Paradise for whoever builds a mosque, small as it may be only for a pigeon to lay its eggs in.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 739, Page No. 106

Verse: God will create a good relation between people and the one who establishes a good relation with Him, and will amend the outward conditions of the one who rectifies his inner self.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 740; Page No. 106

Verse: An elder brother has the same right on his younger brothers as a father's on his children.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 200; Page No. 34&35

Verse: The Exalted God says: My forgiveness is more bountiful and greater than covering a Muslim's deed in this world to reveal it afterwards; and thus, so long as my servants ask my forgiveness I will forgive them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1985; Page No. 278

Verse: The Exalted God says: O son of Adam! Every day your sustenance is given to you but you are sad, and everyday your life gets shorter but you are happy. You have what suffices you but you ask for what makes of you a rebel. You are neither content with less nor satiated with more.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1986; Page No. 278

Verse: The Exalted God says: O son of Adam! There are three things of which one is specifically mine, i.e. you should worship Me and take nothing as a partner with me, one is specifically yours, i.e. I will reward or punish you for what you do (if I forgive you, it is because I am the most Compassionate, the most Merciful(, and one is between Me and you, i.e. you should pray to and ask Me, and I should accept and grant what you request.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1987; Page No. 278

Verse: The Exalted God says: purity (of intention( is the best form of worship My servants can offer Me.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1988; Page No. 278

Verse: The Exalted God says: Son of Adam annoys Me by blaming Time, for I am Time with all affairs in My authority. I am the One who changes day and night.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1989; Page No. 278&279

Verse: The Exalted God says: when a servant approaches Me to the extent of one span, I will get close to him one meter, if he does so to the extent of one meter, I will draw near him more than two meters, and if he approaches Me slowly, I'll go towards him quickly.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1990; Page No. 279

Verse: The Exalted God says: when I inflict my servants with a calamity concerning their bodies, children and wealth and they happen to welcome it patiently, I'll be ashamed to spread out their books of deeds or to call them to the scales of justice in the Day of judgment.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1991; Page No. 279

Verse: The Exalted God says: when one of My servants intends to perform a good deed but he stops doing so, I will record a good deed for him, and if he performs it, I will record ten to seven hundred good deeds for him. Conversely, if he intends to perform a bad deed, but stops doing so, I will not record it. However, if he puts it into action, I will record for him only one bad dead.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1992; Page No. 279

Verse: The Exalted God says: who is crueler than he who wishes to create a creature as Mine? Let those who claim the ability of so doing create a single grain, an ant or a barley seed!
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1993; Page No. 279&280

Verse: The Exalted God says: whoever is not satisfied with what I have destined, and not patient in calamities, should seek a god other than Me.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1994; Page No. 280

Verse: The Exalted God shelters anyone who does the following three, and lets him (her) to Paradise: being moderate towards the poor, being kind to parents and being kind to subordinates.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1995; Page No. 280

Verse: The Exalted God will avenge anyone who oppresses somebody in this world, if the latter is not able to revenge the former in person.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1996; Page No. 280

Verse: The Exalted God will definitely help three groups of people: strugglers in the way of God, slaves struggling for their freedom and men getting married to keep their chastity intact.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1997; Page No. 280

Verse: The Exalted God will dress a Muslim with green heavenly clothes if he provides a naked (poor) Muslim with worldly dresses. The Exalted God will let a Muslim taste heavenly fruits in the Day of Judgment, if he feeds a hungry Muslim. And the Exalted God will let a Muslim drink the untouched drink in the Day of judgment, if he quenches the thirst of another Muslim.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1998; Page No. 280&281

Verse: The Exalted God will expose a leader's face to fire in the Day of Judgment, if he undertakes an affair of my people but carries it out without the care and effort the has for his own fairs.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1999; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will forgive the sins of the one who terminates the contract with a regretful man.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2000; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will increase the wealth of the one who opens the door of generosity through giving charity or gifts (to people), and will decrease it should (s)he open the door of(excessive) requests, seeking an increase in his wealth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2001; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will let a Muslim to Paradise if four people testify to his being good.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2002; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will make a Muslim associate with an act of worship, feeling its pleasure in his heart, when he casts a first glance at a woman but immediately turns his eyes away from her.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2003; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will not put two swords on this (Islamic) nation simultaneously- one from themselves and the other from their enemies.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2004; Page No. 281

Verse: The Exalted God will punish a group of people who are greater in number and stronger than the sinners among them, but do not manage to stop the latter committing sins.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2005; Page No. 282

Verse: The Exalted God will surely undertake to grant the requests of anyone who lifts up his hands in request to Him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2006; Page No. 282

Verse: The Exalted God's covenant is the most entitled thing to accomplish.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2007; Page No. 282

Verse: The existence of good neighbors leads to the development of cities and long life of communities.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2008; Page No. 282

Verse: The expiation for backbiting someone is to ask God to forgive him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2009; Page No. 282

Verse: The Fire will eat away all man's body save the place of prostration (on his forehead), for the Great, Powerful God has forbidden it to do so.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2010; Page No. 282

Verse: The first step towards religion is well-wishing for the sake of God, His religion, His Prophet and His Book as well as for Muslims and Muslim leaders.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 2011; Page No. 282

Verse: Purify your faith, for a little bit of worship suffices you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1607; Page No. 228

Verse: Put the Divine laws into effect concerning friends and foes alike, and pay no attention to the blames of beraters for that.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1608; Page No. 228

Verse: Putting on your patchy piece is better than picking up a new one belonging to others.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1609; Page No. 228

Verse: Read the Quran and act upon it. Do not leave it, do not exaggerate about it, do not earn your living through it, and do not seek superiority (abundance) by means of it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1610; Page No. 229

Verse: Read the Quran as long as your hearts are in agreement with each other in respect to it, but as soon as disagreement arose among you, rise up.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1611; Page No. 229

Verse: Read the Quran if it keeps you away from evil; if (you feel) it does not, you are not a true reader of it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1612; Page No. 229

Verse: Read the Quran, for the Exalted God does not torture the heart which has perceived it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1613; Page No. 229

Verse: Real patience is realized when one suffers a calamity for the first time.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1614; Page No. 229

Verse: Receive the one who takes refuge in you in the name of God, give something to the one who begs you in the name of God, accept the invitation of the one who invites you, and be kind to the one who is kind to you; if you cannot do so, pray for him instead as long as you make sure you have made up his kindness.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1615; Page No. 230

Verse: Refrain from avarice, for it ruined your predecessors. It led them to misery and they became misers, it led them to breaking the bonds of kinship and they did so, and it led them to wickedness and they became wicked.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1624; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from backbiting, for it is worse than adultery. Verily, when someone commits adultery and repents, God accepts his repentance, but a backbiter will not be forgiven until he is first forgiven by the backbitten.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1625; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from bad friends, for you are identified through them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1626; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from begging, for it is immediate meanness, and the poverty towards which you haste.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1627; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from borrowing, for it leads to the sorrow of night and meanness of day.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1628; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from eulogy, for it is like unto cutting off one's head.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1629; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from foolish friends, for they'll cause you evil, though good they intend.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1630; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from going to extremes in matters religious, for it ruined your predecessors.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1631; Page No. 231

Verse: Refrain from greed, for it is immediate poverty.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1632; Page No. 232

Verse: Refrain from hidden passion: it is when a scholar likes people to sit in his presence.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1633; Page No. 232

Verse: Wine is the mother of all indecent deeds and great capital sins, and whoever drinks it may happen to commit adultery with his own mother and aunts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3147.

Verse: Wine is the mother of all wickedness. Thus, the prayers of the one who drinks wine will not be accepted for forty days, and if he dies with wine in his veins, his death will be that of the Age of Ignorance.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3148.

Verse: Wine makes the totality of all sins.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3149.

Verse: Winter is the spring of a believer.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3150.

Verse: Wisdom causes (and is the object of) intimacy.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3151.

Verse: Wisdom is a believer's lost one. Hearing it from anybody, s(he) takes it in, regardless of its source.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3152.

Verse: Wisdom is loss in matters secular, and joy in matters religious.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3153.

Verse: Wisdom starts with knowing God.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3154.

Verse: Wisdom starts with piety.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3155.

Verse: Wise sayings are believers' lost ones- wherever they happen to find them, they would be more entitled (than others) to catch them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3156.

Verse: Wise sayings are lost ones of the wise.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3157.

Verse: Every heart is hanging from two fingers of the Meciful God's Fingers of Power, which He holds fast or lets fall if He wills, and the scale of people's deeds is in God's hands, by which He will lift up a group or push down another in the Day of Judgment.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 546, Page No. 80

Verse: Every king has restrictions (of his own), and God's one on earth is His prohibitions.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 547; Page No. 80

Verse: Every midnight, the doors of heavens open and a caller calls out: "Is there anyone to pray and enjoy (God's) acceptance? Is there anyone to ask for something to be answered in the positive? Is there a sorrow-stricken to be relieved of his sadness?" Thus, there remains nobody with unaccepted requests, save and adulterous woman who trades her privy parts and a tax- taker who usurps people's property.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 548; Page No. 80

Verse: God will improve one's relation to people, if (s)he improves his/her relation to Him, will correct one's outward status, if (s)he corrects his/her inner self, and will give one sufficiency in the world, if (s)he works for the Hereafter.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 750; Page No. 107

Verse: God will in the Hereafter echo in the ears of people the disgrace of whoever echoes his knowledge in the ears of people (in this world), and will lower and belittle him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 751; Page No. 107

Verse: God will keep His wrath away from the one who restrains one's anger, and will cover the faults of the one who controls one's tongue.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 752; Page No. 108

Verse: God will keep in honor a servant who loves another one (for His sake).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 753; Page No. 108

Verse: God will keep in the Hereafter the secret of the one who keeps the secret of his Muslim brothers in this world and does not disgrace them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 754; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make a servant's property end in good, should (s)he give good charity.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 755; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make a wasteful person rule over anyone who sells something rotten.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 756; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make everybody a company to those whom (s)he loves (in the Hereafter).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 757; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make everything fear the one who fears Him, and will make one fear everything if s(he) fears Him not.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 758; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make everything fear the one who fears Him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 759; Page No. 108

Verse: God will make one suffer the unlawful, if (s)he is ashamed to act upon the lawful.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 760, Page No. 108

Verse: God will make one's faith vanish when s(he) commits adultery or drinks wine, just as one puts off his/her shirt.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 761; Page No. 109

Verse: God will make the sign of His servant's intentions appear in him/her, being they good or evil.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 762; Page No. 109

Verse: God will make up for whoever keeps patient in calamities and will reward whoever swallows his anger.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 763; Page No. 109

Verse: God will make whoever prefers His love to people's, needless of the latter.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 764; Page No. 109

Verse: God will not accept faith without deed and deed without faith.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 765; Page No. 109

Verse: God will not accept the compensating deeds of three groups of people in the Day of Judgment: those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, those who put their donations under compulsion, and those who belie predestination.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 766; Page No. 109

Verse: God will not afflict a people with famine, save for disobedience to Him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 767; Page No. 109

Verse: All forms of loaning are considered charity.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 174; Page No. 31

Verse: All forms of lying are recorded in man's book of deeds, save the following: Telling lie in war for war is deceit, telling women a lie to please them, and telling two persons a lie to make them come to terms.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 175; Page No. 31&32

Verse: All good deeds make one half of worshipping (God) and praying makes the other half, and when the Exalted God wishes good for someone He will make his heart inclined towards praying.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 176; Page No. 32

Verse: All holders of knowledge hunger for new knowledge.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 177; Page No. 32

Verse: All holders of wealth are more entitled than others to use it as they wish.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 178; Page No. 32

Verse: All kinds of knowledge will entail evil results in the Day of Judgment, save that which is put to practice.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 179; Page No. 32

Verse: All my people will enjoy God's forgiveness, save the pretentious-those who (for instance)commit debauchery at night, which the Exalted God conceals from people, but reveal it themselves at daytime despite God's concealment.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 180; Page No. 32

Verse: All of you are observers of and responsible for your subjects' rights.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 181, Page No. 32

Verse: All people are (members of) God's household, but the dearest to Him are the most beneficial for their own family.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 182; Page No. 32

Verse: All sons of Adam are jealous, and a person's jealousy will not be harmful unless (s(he expresses it or puts it into action.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 183; Page No. 33

Verse: All sons of Adam are kings- men ruling over their families and women over their houses.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 184, Page No. 33

Verse: All sons of Adam are wrong doers, and the best among them are the penitent.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 185; Page No. 33

Verse: All sorts of lying are sins, save the one benefiting people.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 186; Page No. 33

Verse: All vices are confined in a house, the key to which being drinking wine.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 187; Page No. 33

Verse: Alms mixed with one's property will surely make it ruin.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 188; Page No. 33

Verse: Alms-giving is a bridge to Islam.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 189; Page No. 33

Verse: Among all believers, the best Muslim is the one from whose hand and tongue other Muslims feel at rest, and the most faithful one is the most good-tempered.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 190; Page No. 33

Verse: Among man's good prayers is to have a good opinion of God.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 191; Page No. 33

Verse: Among people, the best is one who brings them utmost gain (and rest).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 192; Page No. 33&34

Verse: Among the best of all deeds is to gladden a believer by paying his debt, meeting his need and putting an end to his suffering.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 193; Page No. 34

Verse: Among the great aspects of good-manneredness are the following three: forgiving those who treat you unjustly, joining those who cut relations with you, and tolerating those who insist in their ignorance against you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 194; Page No. 34

Verse: Among the prophets' patterns of life are chastity, forbearance, brushing one's teeth and using perfume.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 195; Page No. 34

Verse: Among the worst people is the one who barters his spiritual world for people's material world.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 196; Page No. 34

Verse: Among your brethren the best, your faults to you manifest.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 197; Page No. 34

Verse: Amuse yourselves with plays and recreations, for I dislike watching violence in your religion.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 198; Page No. 34

Verse: An angel will pray the same for whoever prays for his brother in his absence.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 199; Page No. 34

Verse: He who does not accept an apology, be it from an honest man or a liar, will not be with me at the Heavenly Pool [in Paradise].
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 7032; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 586

Verse: Nothing is more honored by Allah than the son of Adam.' He was asked, 'Not even the angels, O Messenger of Allah?' He said, 'The angels are compelled [by predestination] like the sun and the moon.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34621; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 586

Verse: Nothing is better than a thousand of its like, except for man.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34615; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 587

Verse: The market is a place of distraction and negligence, so whoever occupies himself therein with the glorification of Allah, Allah records for him the worth of a million good deeds.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 9330; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 591

Verse: When the servant gets married, he has completed half of his faith, so let him be careful of his duty to Allah in the remaining half.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44403; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 593

Verse: The worst ones from among you are the single ones   two units of prayer performed by a married person is better than seventy units performed by an unmarried person.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44448; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 594

Verse: The beauty of a woman's faith must be given priority over the beauty of her face.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44590; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 595

Verse: The best dowry is the simplest one.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44707; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 596

Verse: Marry into a good tribe for verily what is bred-in-the-bone will come out in the flesh.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44559; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 596

Verse: Choose carefully for your seed, for verily women give birth to children who resemble their own brothers and sisters.'
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44557; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 596

Verse: The person with the greatest right over a woman is her husband, and the person with the greatest right over a man is his mother.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44771; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 597

Verse: If a man quenches his wife's thirst he is rewarded for it
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44435; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 599

Verse: There is nothing more beneficial to a believer after his piety and devotion to Allah than a virtuous wife.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 444410; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 601

Verse: The best source of enjoyment in this world is a virtuous wife
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44451; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 601

Verse: When you are invited to a wedding banquet, do accept
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44617; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 603

Verse: Announce this marriage and let it take place in the mosque.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44536; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 603

Verse: Publicize the marriage, but conceal the engagement.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44532; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 603

Verse: The martyred one is forgiven every sin except his debt [to others].
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 11110; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 604

Verse: He who faces his enemy and resists until either he is killed or he vanquishes him will not be tormented in the grave
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 10662; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 604

Verse: Whoever is unjustly killed is a martyr
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, 11205; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 605

Verse: Whoever loves someone passionately, then suppresses his love in order to remain chaste and dies in the process, is a martyr.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 11203; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 605

Verse: Whoever is wounded in the way of Allah will rise up on the Day of Resurrection, his fragrance as sweet as musk and his colour as vibrant as saffron, and he will have the stamp of a martyr on him. And whoever sincerely asks Allah to grant him martyrdom, Allah grants him the reward of a martyr, even if he dies in his own bed.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 11144 ; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 606

Verse: Verily every religion has a natural disposition and the natural disposition of Islam is modesty.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5757; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 615

Verse: Every one of you should be modest in front of his two angels that are with him, just as you would be modest with two righteous neighbours that are with you day and night
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5751; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 617

Verse: Two sounds are cursed in this world as well as in the Hereafter: the sound of the flute played [in celebration] for a bounty, and the twang [of string instruments played] during a calamity.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 40661; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 623

Verse: Mine is a blessed community - whether its first is the better or its last is unknown.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34451; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 625

Verse: This community of mine is had mercy upon by Allah
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34452; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 625

Verse: If bad-temperedness were a man walking(living) among people, it would be a bad one, and the Exalted God has surely not created me an abusive man.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 986; Page No. 139

Verse: If believers knew about the punishment of God, no one of them would covet for Paradise, and if infidels knew about God's mercy, they would not be hopeless of (being allowed to) Paradise.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 987; Page No. 139

Verse: If evil and abuse were creatures of Allah, they would be the worst of all.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 988; Page No. 140

Verse: If faith were in the firmament, (some) men of Persia would find a way to it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 989; Page No. 140

Verse: If God grants you wealth, the sign of His blessing and generosity should appear in you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 990; Page No. 140

Verse: If God's servants didn't commit sins, He would create a people who would commit sins to be forgiven by Him, for He is the most Merciful and Forgiving.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 991; Page No. 140

Verse: If hardship enters a hole, relief will do too to make the former vanish.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 992; Page No. 140

Verse: If I had gold as much as Mount Uhud, I would like to have nothing of it with me within three days, save for a piece by which to repay my debts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 993; Page No. 140

Verse: If I were to command anyone to prostrate anyone else, I would command women to prostrate their husbands, for God has invested the latter with rights in respect to the former.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 995, Page No. 140

Verse: If it is said to the dwellers of Hell that they will stay there to the number of sands on the earth, they will rejoice, and if the same is said to the dwellers of Paradise, they will feel sad, but God has granted eternal life to the latter.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 996; Page No. 141

Verse: If it were not for beggars' telling lie, those who repelled them would not be praised.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 997; Page No. 141

Verse: If it would not cause trouble for my people, I would order them to brush their teeth at prayer times.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 998; Page No. 141

Verse: If it would not cause trouble for my people, I would order them to brush their teeth at dawns.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 999; Page No. 141

Verse: If knowledge were hanging from the firmament, a group of Persians would (manage to) acquire it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1000; Page No. 141

Verse: If modesty were a man, it would be a decent one.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1001; Page No. 141

Verse: If nothing remains save one single day from the life in this world, God will prolong it so much that a man from my household will rise to fill the earth with equity just as it was filled with injustice and enormity- a man whose name and whose father's are respectively mine and my father's.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1002; Page No. 141

Verse: If the Resurrection fell upon one among you while having a sapling in his (her) hand, (s)he should plant it, if possible.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1011; Page No. 143

Verse: "The evil deed punished first is injustice done to others."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 343

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "If a mountain does injustice to another mountain the Almighty Allah will raze it to the ground."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 343

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his ancestors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "The evil deed to be punished first is injustice."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 343

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates that a person challenged a man from Bani Hashim to fight with him. The person refused to fight. Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said, "Why didn't you fight?" The Hashimite replied, "That person is a very brave Arab and I think he can beat me easily." Imam (a.s.) said, "If he has done injustice to you, you should have fought with him and overpowered him, because if a mountain does injustice to another, Allah destroys the unjust mountain."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 343/344

Verse: "One who begs in spite of having rations for next three days, will not have flesh on this face when he meets Allah on the Day of Judgment."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 344

Verse: "One who asks for a thing which he does not need, will not die till he is deprived of it and Allah will throw him in Hell because of this deed."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 344

Verse: "A person who commits suicide will remain in Hell forever."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 344

Verse: The best struggle to God, the Exalted, is to utter a word of truth in the presence of a tyrant ruler.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1943; Page No. 272

Verse: The best testimony is that which is borne before its bearer is required to.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1944; Page No. 272

Verse: The best thing infused in (man's) heart is certainty.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1945; Page No. 272

Verse: The best wife is the one who gladdens you when you look at her, obeys your orders, and preserves her body and your property in your absence.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1946; Page No. 272

Verse: The best witness is s(he) who bears testimony before being required to.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1947; Page No. 272

Verse: The best wives have the least marriage portions.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1948; Page No. 272

Verse: The best woman is an affectionate one who bears many a child.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1949; Page No. 272

Verse: The best woman is the one who gladdens her husband when he looks at her, obeys his orders, and avoids doing anything he dislikes through her body and property.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1950; Page No. 272

Verse: Repentance expiates sins. If you did not commit sins, God would create other people to commit sins to be forgiven by Him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1678; Page No. 237

Verse: Repentance from a sin is to stop committing that sin again.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1679; Page No. 237

Verse: Repentance has a door in the west, open as long as seventy years, till some verses of your Lord come down, and then the Sun will rise from it's west.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1680; Page No. 237

Verse: Respect those who teach you as well as those whom you teach.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1681; Page No. 237

Verse: Restore your patients to health through charity, for it wards off all sorts of illness and evil.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1682; Page No. 238

Verse: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him/her a liar, and claiming to take back one's rights without conniving at any part of it suffices to show his/her stinginess.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1683; Page No. 238

Verse: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him/her a liar.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1684; Page No. 238

Verse: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him/her a sinner.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1685; Page No. 238

Verse: Return the residue of thread and cloth (to their owners), for whoever commits treachery in these, will be demanded in the Day of Judgment to provide the like of them, without being able to do so.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1686; Page No. 238

Verse: Return to the Exalted God for forgiveness, for I myself do so a hundred times a day.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1687; Page No. 238

Verse: Choose many friends, for your Lord is so modest and merciful that He hesitates to chastise His servant among his brothers (in faith) in the Day of Judgment.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 390; Page No. 60

Verse: Choose suitable containers for your sperms, for women give birth to the like of their brothers and sisters.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 391; Page No. 60

Verse: Choose suitable containers for your sperms, marry women (and give your daughters in marriage to men) of equal status to yours.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 392; Page No. 60

Verse: Choose your neighbor before buying a house, and find a friend before taking a trip.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 393; Page No. 60

Verse: Choose your neighbor before buying a house, your companion before selecting a way, and your provision before setting out on a trip.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 394; Page No. 60

Verse: Choosing a bride from one's own family is like growing grass in one's own house.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 395; Page No. 60

Verse: Clean your clothes, beautify your hair, brush your teeth and be all made up and tidy, for the children of Israel did not do so and their wives turned out to be adulterous.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 396; Page No. 60&61

Verse: Clean your mouths by brushing.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 397; Page No. 61

Verse: Clean yourself of urine, for it's the cause of most punishments in the grave.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 398; Page No. 61

Verse: Committing adultery with ten women is less sinful than doing so with a neighbor's wife, and stealing from ten houses is easier (i.e. has an easier punishment) than robbing a neighbor's house.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 405; Page No. 61

Verse: Compared with martyrs' blood, the learned's ink is weightier (worthier).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 406; Page No. 62

Verse: Complete repentance is repenting (one's) sins in the sense that when you commit a sin, you should ask for the Exalted God's forgiveness and never commit that sin again.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 407; Page No. 62

Verse: Connivance at the world is of patience and is much harder to do than to use swords in the way of God, the Powerful, the Great.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 408; Page No. 62

Verse: Connive at a scholar's slip and await him to the right direction to keep.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 409; Page No. 62

Verse: Connive at the shortcomings of the merciful people; for by the God who rules over my soul, whenever one of them slips, a helping hand to him God gives.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 410; Page No. 62

Verse: Connive at the sins of a generous man, for whenever he slips, God gives him a hand.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 411; Page No. 62

Verse: Connive at what you are worried about its performance.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 412; Page No. 62

Verse: Connive at whatever your heart does not accept.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 413; Page No. 62

Verse: Constant contention (with others) suffices to make of you a sinner.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 414, Page No. 62

Verse: Consult women concerning their daughters.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 415, Page No. 63

Verse: Consultation is a wall for regret and safety against reproach.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 416; Page No. 63

Verse: The best of faith is to know that Allah is with you wherever you are.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 66; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 289

Verse: The best of faith is patience and liberality.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 74; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 289

Verse: Faith has about seventy branches, the best of them is the statement: "There is no god but Allah", and the lowest of them is to remove obstacles from the path. And chastity is a branch of faith.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 52; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 290

Verse: The strongest bonds of faith are: accepting Allah's guardianship, to love for the sake of Allah and to hate for the sake of Allah.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 43525; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 291

Verse: Three qualities which, when present in a person, enable him to savour the taste of faith: that nothing is more beloved to him than Allah and His Messenger, that to be burned in the Fire is more beloved to him than to denounce his religion, and that he loves for the sake of Allah and hates for the sake of Allah.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 72]; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 293

Verse: The believer is dearer to Allah than His closest angels.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 821; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 296

Verse: The believers' blood is coequal, and they are one hand against others, the most inferior among them is empowered by their protection [of him].
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 402; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 297

Verse: The believer is nice and simple, such that he could be mistaken to be stupid because of his simplicity.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 690; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 297

Verse: The believer is he whom people trust with their blood and their property.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 739; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 297

Verse: The believer is he whose soul is inconvenienced because of him so people can be at ease.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 752; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 297

Verse: The believer initiates the greeting of peace (sal?m) whereas the hypocrite says, 'Not until it is said to me first!
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 778; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 297

Verse: The believer likes others and is well-liked by them, and there is no good to be found in one who does not get along with others and whom people do not get along with. The best of people is the most useful from among them.'
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 679; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 298

Verse: He whose good deed pleases him and whose sin upsets him is indeed a believer.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 700; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 298

Verse: The faith of one who has seen me is no great wonder, but what is truly amazing is for the people who have only seen pages with black [ink] on it [i.e. the Qur'an] and have believed in it from beginning to end.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34582; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 303

Verse: When will I see my brothers?!' to which they replied, 'Are we not your brothers?' He said, 'No, you are my companions. My brothers are those who believe in me without having seen me, and I am filled with longing for them.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 34583; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 303

Verse: Eat and drink and give something in charity. Dress yourselves without prodigality and vanity.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 526; Page No. 77

Verse: Every single servant who desires to raise his own status in this world, Allah abases his status in the Hereafter by a greater and longer extent.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 6144; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 307

Verse: Fasting is incumbent upon you, for verily it severs the roots [of desires] and removes wildness.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 23610; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 308

Verse: How can you notice a speck in your brother' s eye but overlook the tree stump in your own!
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 44141; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 313

Verse: He who conceals a fellow believer' s shameful act is as if he has revived a newborn girl buried-alive551 from her grave.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 6387; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 314

Verse: Knowledge and wealth cover up every fault, whereas ignorance and poverty disclose every fault.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 28669; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 316

Verse: If you knew the extent of Allah's mercy, you would have depended on it and performed only a few deeds, and if you knew the extent of Allah's anger, you would believe that you will not be saved.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5894; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 319

Verse: If anything could take precedence over fate, it would (definitely) be an evil eye.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 985; Page No. 139

Verse: Whoever fears is active during the night, and whoever is active during the night reaches the [desired] station. Verily Allah's commodity is valuable, verily Allah's commodity is Paradise.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5885; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 320

Verse: Allah does not empower anyone over man except one whom he fears. If man was to fear none but Allah, Allah would not allow anyone else to dominate him other than Himself. Man is not assigned to anyone except him in whom he places his hope and if he hopes in none but Allah, he will not be assigned to anyone other than Him.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 5909; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 322

Verse: Adorn your festivals with frequent chants of Allahu Akbar (Allah is the Greatest).
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 24094; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 326

Verse: Adorn the two festivals ('id al-fitr and 'id al-adhha) with frequent chants of la ilaha illallah (There is no god but Allah), Allahu Akbar (Allah is the Greatest), al-Hamdu lillah (All praise is due to Allah), and with glorification of Allah.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 24095; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 327

Verse: It is narrated in Kanz al-`Aummal The Prophet (SAWA) used to go out in the streets on the two festivals chanting la ilaha illallah (There is no god but Allah) and Allahu Akbar (Allah is the Greatest) in a loud voice.
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 18101; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 327

Verse: Every breath of man has its share in fornication which he is inevitably aware of at the time. The fornication of the eye is to look [at that which is forbidden to it], and the fornication of the foot is to walk [to where it is forbidden for it], and for the ear to listen [to that which is forbidden].
VerseRef: Kanz al-`Ummal, no. 13026; Mizan ul Hikmah page No. 338

Verse: Early morning sleep wards off one's sustenance.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 525; Page No. 76&77

Verse: Eat currant, for it condenses the bile, makes phlegm vanish, strengthens the nerves, and makes the mind sharp, the nature good, the soul purified and one's grief escape.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 527; Page No. 77

Verse: Eating (food) in bazaars shows one's meanness.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 528; Page No. 77

Verse: Eight groups of God's servants will be the most detested of all in the Day of Judgment: liars, selfish people, those who meet their brothers (in faith) joyfully while reserving enmity for them in their hearts, those who are slow in accepting the call to God and His prophet, but quick in following the call to Satan, those who resort to swearing in order to achieve their worldly requests, though having no claim to it, tale-bearers, those who create discord among friends, and those who oppress the fallen innocent people and are called dirty by the Great, Merciful God.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 529; Page No. 77

Verse: Engage yourself in acts of worship to the extent of your ability, for as you get exhausted, God gets exhausted too.Verily, the most beloved deed in the sight of God is the most durable, though in quantity little.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 530; Page No. 77&78

Verse: Ensure me that you will act upon the following five, then I ensure you (of entrance) to Paradise: being just (to each other) as to the allocation of inheritance, treating people equitably, leaving fear in battles against enemies, keeping distance with treachery as to spoils and preventing the oppressors to do injustice to the oppressed.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 531, Page No. 78

Verse: Ensure me that you will practice the following six, then I ensure you of (entrance to) Paradise: telling the truth, standing by your promises, returning (people's) trusts, keeping your privy parts (from the unlawful), controlling your eyes and restraining your hands.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 532, Page No. 78

Verse: Entering Paradise, I saw the statement on its door that `charity will be rewarded ten times as much but lending, eighteen times as much. I asked Gabriel for the reason, and he replied: "Charity is to the good of the poor and the rich alike, but lending is only to the good of the needy".
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 533; Page No. 78

Verse: Entering Paradise, on two sites, I saw three statements written in gold, reading ) "There is no god but Allah and Muhammad is His messenger." ) "We arrived at what we sent ahead, availed ourselves of what we made use of, and lost what we left behind.", and ) "What a sinful nation and what a forgiving Lord!"
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 534, Page No. 78&79

Verse: Envy and hatred ruin all the good, just as fire swallows firewood.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 535; Page No. 79

Verse: Even a horned goat having gored an unhorned one will be called to account in the Doomsday when rights are given back to the rightful.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 536; Page No. 79

Verse: Even if you have mercy for a lamb God will be merciful to you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 537; Page No. 79

Verse: Every believer has a sin which (s)he commits once in a while and will not avoid doing it till he dies."
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 538; Page No. 79

Verse: Every blessing is perishable save that of the blessed, and so is every grief save that of the damned.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 539; Page No. 79

Verse: Every distress has its specific remedy, and the remedy of sins is asking for God's mercy.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 540; Page No. 79

Verse: Every distress has its specific remedy, but recovery would be achieved by proper remedy as well as the will of God.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 541, Page No. 79

Verse: Every form of loaning returned in double is usury.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 542; Page No. 79

Verse: Every good deed is a form of charity.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 543; Page No. 79

Verse: Every good deed is charity, and whatever a Muslim dispenses for himself and his kinds will be considered charity, and so are the steps s(he) takes to keep his/her own fame intact.
