Verse: When you vanquish your enemy, let your pardon of him serve as thanksgiving for the power [given to you] over him
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying 11; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 933

Verse: Regard even a little sustenance from Allah as too much for yourself by way of sincere thanksgiving
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 285; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 933

Verse: Thanksgiving for a bounty is accomplished through avoidance of prohibited things, and an expression of complete thanks is when a man says, 'All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 95, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 934

Verse: He whom Allah favours with the bestowal of a bounty and who then acknowledges it with his heart has conveyed [true] thanks for it
VerseRef: al-Kafi, p. 96, no. 15; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 934

Verse: When the Prophet (SAWA) was faced with a situation that pleased him, he used to say, 'Praise be to Allah for this bounty', and when he was faced with a situation that made him sorrowful, he used to say, 'Praise be to Allah in every situation.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, p. 97, no. 19; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 934

Verse: Honesty leads to (increased) sustenance and treachery, to poverty.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 912; Page No. 129

Verse: Honor the one who pays a visit to you.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 913; Page No. 129

Verse: It is narrated in Misbah al-Shari`aa (The Lantern of the Path): 'The lowest level of thankfulness is to see the bounty as coming from Allah irrespective of its cause, and without attaching the heart to any other cause save Allah, Mighty and Exalted. It consists of being satisfied with what is given, and not disobeying Him by means of His bounty, nor opposing Him in any of His commands and prohibitions as a result of that bounty.'
VerseRef: Misbah al-Shari`a, p. 53; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 934

Verse: No good deed is of any benefit if coupled with the following sins: taking a partner with God, displeasing one's parents and escaping from battlefield.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1364; Page No. 194

Verse: No good is there in the company of the one who does not observe the rights you do for him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1365; Page No. 194

Verse: No good is there in the one who does not invite guests.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1366; Page No. 194

Verse: No good is there in the wealth without loss and in the flesh without pain.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1367; Page No. 194

Verse: No grief is like unto that of debt, and no pain is like unto that of eyes.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1368; Page No. 194

Verse: No humility and no piety.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1369; Page No. 195

Verse: No joy can escape being followed by grief.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1370; Page No. 195

Verse: No man will sit with a woman in privacy, unless Satan is the third party to them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1371; Page No. 195

Verse: No matter if the pious is wealthy, but piety is better for them than riches, and peace of mind is among (God's) blessings.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1372; Page No. 195

Verse: No migration will be there after the conquest (of Mecca).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1373; Page No. 195

Verse: No Muslim is allowed to encroach upon another Muslim's possessions including his blood, fame and wealth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1374; Page No. 195

Verse: No Muslim is allowed to encroach upon other Muslim's blood, fame and wealth. Belittling a Muslim brother suffices to show one's evil.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1375; Page No. 195

Verse: No obedience to God fruits in quicker reward than observing bonds of kinship, and no disobedience to Him results in quicker punishment than oppression.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1376; Page No. 195

Verse: No one achieves the state of virtue unless (s)he connives at the permissible, out of fear for the impermissible.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1377; Page No. 196

Verse: No one achieves true faith unless (s)he comes to know that both what (s)he gains and what (s)he doesn't are predestined for him.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1378; Page No. 196

Verse: No one achieves true faith unless (s)he controls his/her tongue.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1379; Page No. 196

Verse: No one but the wicked are deprived of (God's) mercy.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1380; Page No. 196

Verse: Wish for others what you wish for yourself
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 3158.

Verse: Doubt is the product of ignorance.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 725; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: Whoever is insolent with regards to Allah's command becomes prone to doubting, and whoever doubts, Allah, Most Sublime over him, disgraces him with His authority, and belittles him with His Might just as he had shown contempt for His command.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Sa`ada, v. 1, no. 373; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: Do not give in to misgivings lest you start to doubt, and do not doubt lest you disbelieve, and do not allow yourselves to become emboldened [against Allah] lest you fall into self-deception.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 2, p. 54, no. 24; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: Doubt thwarts faith.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 723; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: Doubt extinguishes the light of the heart.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1242; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: The consequence of doubt is confusion.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4619; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: Doubts are dispelled through repetition of one's thought processes
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4271; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 254

Verse: How I wonder at the one who entertains doubts about Allah whilst beholding the very creation of Allah.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying 126; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 255

Verse: A sincere person does not entertain misgivings and a person convinced [of his faith] does not doubt.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 9532; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 255

Verse: Holy Prophet Muhammad al Mustaf? (s.a.w.w.) with regard to Allah's verse in the Qur'an "for them are glad tidings" [Qur'an 10:64], said, 'This is in reference to the good dream which a believer has and which gives him good news in this world.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 8, p. 90, no. 60; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 255

Verse: No remnants of prophecy remain today [in people's lives] except glad tidings.' When asked what glad tidings were, he replied, 'True dreams.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 61, p. 177, no. 39; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 256

Verse: When the Prophet (SAWA) used to wake up in the morning, he used to first ask his companions, 'Are there any good news?' meaning any good dreams.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 8, p. 90, no. 58; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 256

Verse: He who practices self-restraint, his burden decreases and his worth in Allah' s eyes increases
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4597; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 836

Verse: Actions are purified through practice of self-restraint
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4238; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 836

Verse: Self-sacrifice is the highest of virtues
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 986; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: Self-sacrifice is a characteristic of the righteous
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 606; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: Self-sacrifice is the best kindness and the highest rank of belief
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1705; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: Self-sacrifice is the best form of worship and the greatest eminence.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1148; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: The best form of generosity is self-sacrifice
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 2888; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: Treat ordinary people with fairness and treat the believers with self-sacrifice
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 6342; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 837

Verse: The peak of virtues is self-sacrifice
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 6361; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 838

Verse: Through self-sacrifice do free people become enslaved
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4187; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 838

Verse: Abu Hurayra narrated, 'A man came to the Prophet (SAWA) and complained to him of hunger, so the Prophet (SAWA) sent a messenger to the homes of his wives, but they said that they had nothing but water. The Prophet (SAWA) asked, 'Who can host this man tonight?' So Ali b. Abi Talib (AS) said, 'I will host him, O Messenger of Allah.' He came to Fatima (AS) and asked her, 'What do you have, O daughter of the Prophet?' She said, 'We only have food for tonight, but we will give it to our guest.' He (AS) said, 'O Daughter of Muhammad. Take the children to bed and put off the lamp.' The next morning, Ali (AS) came to the Prophet (SAWA) and told him the story. No sooner had he left than Allah, the Exalted, revealed the verse: " but prefer [others] to themselves
VerseRef: Nur al-Thaqalayn, v. 5, p. 285, no. 53; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 838

Verse: The Prophet (SAWA) had never spent three consecutive days having eaten to his fill until he left this world, although he could have, had he wanted to; but he used to place others before himself. (Tradition by Aisha)
VerseRef: Tanbih al-Khawatir, v. 1, no. 172; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 839

Verse: Imam Ali (AS) bought a gown, which he liked, so he gave it away in charity. He said, 'I heard the Prophet (SAWA) saying, 'When a man places others before himself, Allah, the Exalted, will place him [before others] in Paradise
VerseRef: Nur al-Thaqalayn, v. 5, p. 285, no. 52; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 839

Verse: The intellect is immune from wrong and commands good-doing.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1250; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 465

Verse: The intellect sets right all matters.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 404; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 465

Verse: The intellect is a ladder upwards towards the `AeIlliyyin [the loftiest heavens].
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1325; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 465

Verse: Fatima (AS) had some barley which she made into a sweet paste. When they had finished cooking it and placed it on the table, a poor man came and said, 'May Allah have mercy upon you.' So Ali (AS) stood up and gave him a third of it. Soon afterwards, an orphan came and said, 'May Allah have mercy upon you.' Ali (AS) stood up and gave him a third. Soon afterwards, a prisoner of war came and said, 'May Allah have mercy upon you.' So Ali (AS) gave him the last third, and they did not even taste it. So Allah, the Exalted, sent down the Qur'anic verses honouring them, and they apply to every believer who does the same for the sake of Allah, the Exalted
VerseRef: Nur al-Thaqalayn, v. 5, p. 470, no. 20; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 839

Verse: No sooner does a Muslim serve a group of Muslims than Allah will give him servants equal in number [to the group] in Paradise
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 307, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 840

Verse: "The soul of faith will leave the body of one who breaks a single fast in the month of Ramadan."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 299

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his father that according to a will of Amirul Momineen (a.s.): Do not leave the Hajj of the House of your Lord else you will be destroyed. One who does not perform the Hajj because of worldly desires, his desires will not be fulfilled until the pilgrims return after shaving their heads (after completing the Hajj rituals).
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 299

Verse: "One who dies before performing an obligatory Hajj without having a valid reason, like illness or rule of an oppressive king, he has an option either to die as a Jew or a Christian."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 299

Verse: "The human tongue does a favor on other parts of the body every day. It inquires about their condition. The parts of body say: If you spare us, we will remain in good condition. They beg for Allah's mercy and say that if they are rewarded, it is because of the tongue and if they are punished, it is also because of the tongue."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 299/300

Verse: "If three days of a person's life pass by without reciting Surah Tauheed, he is without a companion. Faith will be taken away from him and if that person dies after these three days, he will die as a disbeliever of Allah, the Greatest."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 300

Verse: "One who dies without reciting Surah Ikhlaas on Friday, has died on the religion of Abu Lahab."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 300

Verse: "One who is involved in some disease or calamity and if he dies in such a state without reciting Surah Ikhlaas, he shall go to Hell."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 300

Verse: "One who offers all of the five prayers of a day without reciting Surah Ikhlaas in any of them, will be told: O servant of Allah! You are not of those who pray."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 300/301

Verse: "One who memorizes a Surah of Quran and then forgets it, this Surah will appear on an elevated place on the Day of Judgment with a beautiful look. When the person will look at it, he will ask: Who are you? You are so beautiful that I would have loved to own you. It will reply: Didn't you recognize me? I am so and so Surah. If you hadn't forgotten me, I would have elevated you also to this position."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 301

Verse: Hidden charity cools down God's wrath.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 905; Page No. 128

Verse: It is narrated that Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) said that the Almighty Allah has said, "He has waged a war against Me that insults My believing servant. And he is safe from My anger that respects My believing servant."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 301

Verse: "Allah will forsake in this world and the hereafter one who forsakes a believer in spite of having the capacity to help him."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 301

Verse: "Surely Allah, the Mighty and Sublime has created the believers with the light of His greatness and the majesty of His supremacy. Hence, one who taunts him or turns a deaf ear to his words has rejected Allah on His throne. He will not get anything from Allah; he is only a partner of Shaitaan."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 301/302

Verse: "There is no man that taunts or insults a believer but that he will die the worst death desiring to return to this world to do good."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 302

Verse: "One who keeps away from a believer, the Almighty Allah will veil Paradise from him with seventy thousand walls, each at a distance of a thousand years from one another."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 302

Verse: "A believer making profit from another believer is like one who is taking usury."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 302

Verse: "I hate the person who gives more importance to a mortgaged thing than a Muslim brother."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 302

Verse: "One who has power over a thing belonging to him or to another person which a believer desires to have and if this person does not allow it to be given to the believer, the Almighty Allah will raise him on the Day of Judgment with a black face, blind and hands tied to the back of his neck. It will be said: 'This is that untrustworthy person who distrusted Allah and His Messenger (s.a.w.s.).' He will be ordered to be taken to the fire (of Hell)."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 302/303

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) told Yunus, "One who deprives a believer of his right, the Almighty Allah will make him stand on his feet for five hundred years on the Day of Judgment. He will sweat so much the earth will be filled it. A caller will call out: this is that unjust person who deprived the believer of his right. He will continuously receive punishment for forty years, then he will be ordered to be taken to the fire (of Hell)."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 303

Verse: "One who withholds the wealth of a believer which he needed, by Allah, he will never taste the food of Paradise nor will he be able to taste the sealed drink of Paradise."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 303

Verse: "One who blames a believing man or woman falsely, the Almighty Allah will count him among 'Teenat-e-Khabaal' on the Day of judgment." The narrator asked the meaning of 'Teenat-e-Khabaal'. Imam answered, "The dirty liquid coming out of the private parts of a fornicator woman."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 303

Verse: Imam Muhammad Baqir (a.s.) narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Abusing a believer, doing hypocrisy and killing him is disbelief. And eating his flesh (Backbiting) is disobedience of Allah."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 303

Verse: "One who repeats the words of a believer with an intention to expose him, insult his personality or reduce his respect among the people, Allah will take away His guardianship and make Shaitaan as his guardian."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 304

Verse: He who obeys someone in committing an act of disobedience [to Allah] has indeed worshipped him.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 398, no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1015

Verse: One who has a house and if a believer desires to live in that house but the former does not allow him, the Almighty Allah says, "O My angels! This man is acting miserly in giving shelter to My servant in this world. I swear by My honor, he will never receive a place in My Paradise."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 304

Verse: Abi Burda relates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) offered Salaat with them. Then he got up immediately, touched the wall of the mosque and loudly said, "O those who have accepted faith apparently but the faith has not reached their hearts! Do not expose the defects of the believers. One who tries to find the faults of a believer, Allah brings out faults in him. If Allah brings out faults in a person, he will be disgraced even if he is inside the Holy Kaaba."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 304

Verse: A community had committed a number of sins. However they stopped committing them after a period and began to fear those sins a lot. Some people came forward and said, "Your sins are around our necks." The Almighty Allah sent chastisement on them and said: "Those people used to fear Me and you tried to be haughty."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 305

Verse: "Surely whenever a believer intends to commit a sin, he is deprived of his sustenance."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 305

Verse: "One who intends to perform a sin, should avoid it because it might happen that Allah watches him committing a sin and says: I swear by My honor, I will never forgive you."
VerseRef: Iqbal al-A`amal, page 305

Verse: "One who recites Surah Muddassir in his obligatory Salaat it is the duty of Allah to give him a status along with Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and he will not face any difficulty in his worldly life, God-Willing."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 164

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Qiyamat regularly and acts upon it, Allah would raise him from the grave with the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.) in the best form. He would be given glad-tiding and he would pass through Sirat and Mizan smiling.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 164

Verse: "One who recites Surah Insan in the morning of every Thursday Allah would marry him to eight hundred virgin women and four thousand women who had been married previously and give him one more Hoorul Ein and company of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.)."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 165

Verse: "Whoever recites Surah Mursalaat, Naba and Nazia'at, it becomes a way of sincerity and a means of affection between him and Prophet Muhammad (s.a.w.s.). If one recites "Amma Yatasaa-aloon" (Surah Naba) daily for one year a year would not pass but he would have the honor of paying homage to the Holy House of Allah, if Allah wills. One who recites Surah Nazia'at, would not die except as cheerful and hearty, and Allah would not raise him from the grave but in happy and pleasant state, and he would not enter Paradise except as happy and joyful."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 165

Verse: "One who recites Surah Abas and Takrim would remain under the shade of Allah and would remain safe from usurping others' property. He would receive favor of Allah and go to Paradise. And it is not a big thing for Almighty Allah."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 165

Verse: "One who recites Surah Infitar and Surah Inshiqaq in his obligatory and recommended prayer, Allah will eliminate all the barriers to the fulfillment of his desires. There would be nothing to stop him. Allah will look at him with mercy till accounting of deeds of all the people is done."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 166

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Mutaffifeen in his obligatory prayers, Allah would keep him safe from the fire of Hell on the Day of Judgment, neither would the fire of Hell see him nor will he see the fire of Hell, and the reciter of Surah Mutaffifeen would not have to pass over the bridge of Hell, not would face any questioning on the Day of Judgment.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 166

Verse: "One who recites Surah Buruj in his obligatory prayers, by virtue of the dignity of this Surah, he would be raised among the prophets because this Surah is related to them."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 166

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Tariq in his obligatory prayer would enjoy great prestige and position before Allah on the Day of Judgment and he would be among the friends of the prophets and their companions in Paradise.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 166

Verse: Whoever recites Surah A'laa in his obligatory and recommended prayers, it would be said to him on the Day of Judgment: Enter Paradise from whichever door you like.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 167

Verse: One who regularly recites: Surah Ghashiya in his obligatory and recommended prayers, Allah's mercy would pervade him in this world as well as the next, and on the Day of Judgment, Allah would keep that man safe and protected from the chastisement of fire.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 167

Verse: "Recite Surah Fajr in your obligatory and recommended prayers. This Surah is related to Imam Husain bin Ali (a.s.). Hence the reciter of this Surah will get a position near Imam Husain (a.s.) in Paradise on the Day of Judgment. Surely Allah is Honored and Wise."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 167

Verse: "One who recites Surah Balad in his obligatory prayers will be a virtuous man in this world. He would be known on the Day of Judgment as a person of high rank near Allah. He would be a friend of prophets, martyrs and virtuous on the Day of Judgment."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 167

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Shams, Surah Lail, Surah Zuha and Surah Alam Nashrah in one day or night, nothing would remain that would not stand witness for his recitation on the Day of Judgment, so much so that the reciter's hair, face, blood, muscles and even bones would stand witness for him, and everything that grows from the earth would stand witness along with them and Allah would say: I have accepted the evidence of all of you for My servant, now admit him into Paradise and give him all that he likes on My behalf. Along with this also give him more by virtue of My mercy and favor.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 168

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Teen in his obligatory and recommended prayers would be given a place in Paradise of his liking, if Allah wills.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 168

Verse: If someone recites Surah Alaq in the day or night and then he dies the same day or night it is as though he achieved the rank of martyrdom and he would remain alive like a martyr who might have used his sword along with the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.).
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 168

Verse: "One who recites Surah Qadr loudly is like a person who raises sword in the way of Allah and one who recites Surah Qadr in low voice is like a person who is smeared in blood fighting in the way of Allah. One who recites it ten times, Allah will forgive one thousand sins committed by him."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 168/169

Verse: "Whoever recites Surah Qadr in his obligatory prayers Allah makes an announcer to announce: O servant of Allah all your past sins have been forgiven; now you pay attention to your deeds."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 169

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Bayyinah, is untouched by Polytheism, hateful of polytheists and has entered the religion of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.), and on the Day of Judgment, Allah would raise him as a believer, and his accounting would be very easy.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 169

Verse: Do not get tired of reciting Surah Iza Zulzilatul Ardh, because whoever recites it in his obligatory or recommended prayers would never face the calamity of an earthquake by Power of Allah and would not die because of earthquake or lightning, nor would his death occur through other calamities of the world. When he dies, it would be ordered that he be taken to Paradise, Allah, the Blessed, would say: My servant you are an ornament for My Paradise, so take your abode in it wherever you like, nothing of this place is inadmissible to you, nor would anything of this place be kept away from you.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 169

Verse: One who recites Surah Adiyat, would be with Ali (a.s.) on the Day of Judgment and would be among his special companions.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 170

Verse: "Whoever recites Surah Qariya would be kept safe by Allah from acting upon the mischief of Dajjal and he would remain safe from the chastisement of Hell."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 170

Verse: Whoever recites Al-Haakumut Takathur (Surah Takathur) in his obligatory Prayer, reward for a hundred martyrs would be written for him by command of Allah and whoever recites it in his recommended prayers, Allah would grant him reward for fifty martyrs. Further, if Allah wills, forty rows of angels would offer prayer with the reciter of Surah Takathur.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 170

Verse: "One who recites Surah Takathur before going to bed would remain safe from the chastisement of grave."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 170

Verse: Whoever recites Surah Asr in his optional prayers, Allah would raise him on the Day of Judgment with cheerful and smiling face and happy and cool eyes, and eventually he would be admitted into Paradise.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 170

Verse: Whoever recites 'Wailul Lekulle Humazah' (Surah Humazah) in his obligatory prayers, Allah would remove poverty and destitution from him and make livelihood easy for him and also keep him safe from accidental or bad death.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 171

Verse: "One who recites Surah Feel in his obligatory prayers all deserts, mountains and soil will bear witness that the person is regular in offering prayers. A call will be given out on the Day of Judgment, 'You had said right about My servant and I have accepted your testimony. Make him enter Paradise on account of this testimony and do not account for his deeds because I love him and his deeds. "
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 171

Verse: Among Allah's exhortations to Prophet Jesus (AS) was, 'O Jesus, call upon Me with a supplication of a sorrowful one, as if he is drowning and has no saviour and only supplicate Me by imploring Me, with the supplication being your prime concern, for verily if you call Me like that, I will answer you.'
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 314, no. 19; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 911

Verse: The Prophet (SAWA) used to raise his hands and implore and beg [to Allah] just like the poor man begs for food
VerseRef: Makarim al- Akhlaq, v. 2, p. 8, no. 1981; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 911

Verse: Whoever performs the ablution correctly and thereafter prays two units of prayer, completes its genuflexions and prostrations, sends the salutations [at the end of the prayer], praises Allah and the Prophet (SAWA), then asks his need in the right place will not be disappointed, because whoever seeks good from the right place is never disappointed
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 314, no. 20; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 911

Verse: Ask Allah and ask Him in abundance, for verily there is nothing too great for Him
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 302, no. 39; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 911

Verse: Do not regard anything that you seek from Allah as too much, for verily what is with Allah is much greater than you could comprehend.
VerseRef: Makarim al- Akhlaq, v. 2, p. 97, no. 2275; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 912

Verse: Imam Ali (AS) in his counsel to his son al-Hasan (AS) said, Your request [from Allah] must be for such as will aid you of the things whose beauty and goodness will remain for you and whose evil consequences will not touch you, and wealth will neither remain for you, and nor will you remain for it
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 205, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 912

Verse: An old woman from among the Israelites asked Moses (AS) a question; she said, 'I will not do what you wish until you give me a few things: you cause my leg to work, give me back my sight, return to me my youth and make me be with you in Paradise
VerseRef: al-Faqih, v. 1, p. 193, no. 594; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 912

Verse: When someone supplicates, he should pray for everyone, for it renders his supplication more conducive to being answered, and whoever precedes forty from among his brothers in supplication before supplicating for himself, his supplication for them as well as himself will duly be answered.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 313, no. 17; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 912

Verse: A supplication asked in secret equals seventy supplications asked openly
VerseRef: al-Da`awat, p. 18, no. 7; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 913

Verse: No sooner do four people congregate to supplicate together for one matter than they depart with an answer
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 487, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 913

Verse: Supplicate to Allah being convinced that he will answer you.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 305, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 913

Verse: When you supplicate, be optimistic that your request has reached the door [of Allah].
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 473, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 913

Verse: The best time to supplicate to Allah, Mighty and Exalted, is the time before dawn', then he recited the verse which is the saying of Prophet Jacob241 (AS), "I shall plead with my Lord to forgive you", then he said, 'He postponed [supplicating for them] till the time before dawn
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 477, no. 6; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 914

Verse: There are three times when supplication is not veiled from Allah at all: after completion of an obligatory act, during rainfall, and during the manifestation of a miraculous sign from Allah on the earth.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 85, p. 321, no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 914

Verse: The believer continues to remain in goodness, comfort, and mercy from Allah as long as he does not seek a hasty response, then despair and abandon supplication as a consequence'. The Imam was asked, 'How does he hasten?', to which he (AS) replied, 'He says, 'I have supplicated since such and such a time and I do not yet see an answer.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 374, no. 16; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 915

Verse: Allah, Blessed and most High, has said, 'O son of Adam, obey Me in what I have commanded, and do not instruct Me about what is good for you
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 71, p. 178, no. 24; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 915

Verse: Verily Allah revealed to Prophet David (AS), 'O David, verily no sooner does a servant from among My servants obey Me in what I have commanded him than I give him before he asks Me, and I answer him before he supplicates Me
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 376, no. 16; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 915

Verse: The one who sends up to Allah his pure and sincere worship, Allah, Mighty and Exalted, sends down for him that which will be of most benefit to him
VerseRef: Tanbih al-Khawatir, v. 2, p. 108; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 916

Verse: I guarantee that the one who does not harbour anything but contentment in his heart will be answered when he supplicates to Allah
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 43, p. 351, no. 25; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 916

Verse: He who does not place his hope in people for anything and refers all his matters instead to Allah, Allah - Mighty and Exalted - will grant his every need.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 75, p. 110. no. 16; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 916

Verse: Beware of the supplication of the parent, for verily it is sharper than a sword
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 74, p. 84, no. 94; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 917

Verse: The supplications of the children of my community are answered as long as they have not fallen into sins
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 357, no. 14; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 917

Verse: The one who recites the Qur'an has a supplication of his answered, be it immediately or later
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 313, no. 17; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 917

Verse: I asked Allah not to answer the supplication of an enamoured one against his beloved
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 378, no. 21; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 917

Verse: Make use of some of the [commodities of this] world to help you in the next world, for I have heard Abu `Aabdallah (AS) [i.e. Imam al-Sadiq] say, 'Make use of some of this [abode] for that one, but do not be a burden on other people (narrated by Mufazzal b. `Aumar)
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 381, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 929

Verse: Love of the world is the origin of every act of disobedience and the beginning of every sin.
VerseRef: Tanbih al-Khawatir, v. 2, p. 122; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1000

Verse: The fountainhead of every mistake is love of the world.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 315, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1000

Verse: Love of the world corrupts the intellect, it deafens the heart from hearing wisdom and it brings about a painful chastisement.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4878; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1000

Verse: Love of the world engenders greed.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4872; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1000

Verse: The one who attaches his heart to the world has attached his heart to three things, endless worry, false expectation and an unattainable hope.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 320, no. 17; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: Whoever increasingly becomes ensnared by the world, his distress will be greater when separating from it.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 320, no. 16; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: By Allah, this world of yours is worse in my eyes than the sweat of a pig in the palm of a leper.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying 236; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: This world of yours is more forsaken to me than the sneezing of a goat.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Sermon 3; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: Verily your world to me is more worthless than a leaf being gnawed at in the mouth of a locust. What has Ali got to do with perishable things?!
VerseRef: Sharhe Nahj al-Balagha by Abi al-Hadid, v. 11, p. 246; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: Get away from me, O World! Your rein is on your own shoulders as I have released myself from your ditches, removed myself from your snares and avoided walking into your slippery places.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Letter 45; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: Beware of the world, for verily it appears sweet and green, surrounded by carnal and base desires.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Sermon 111; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1001

Verse: Do not allow the abundance of what amazes you in it to deceive you because it will be only a little that you take from it.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 118, no. 109; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1003

Verse: Talk to people about what they can understand. Do you want them to deny God and His Prophet?
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1823; Page No. 257

Verse: Talking about something to a people with deficient intellect causes evil for some of them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1824; Page No. 257

Verse: Teach (your knowledge to others).Be easy-going and do not be hard on people. Be open-faced and do not treat people harshly. When one of you gets angry, he/she should keep silent.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1825; Page No. 257

Verse: Teach and do not be hard (on the learners), for an (easy-going) teacher is better than a crude one.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1826; Page No. 258

Verse: Teach your children shooting, for it is the cause of disgrace for your enemies.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1827; Page No. 258

Verse: Teach your children swimming and shooting, and your women, spinning.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1828; Page No. 258

Verse: Teach your children swimming and shooting. What a good hobby is spinning wheel at home for a pious woman! When your mother and your father call you (simultaneously), respond to your mother (first).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1829; Page No. 258

Verse: Teachers and learners equally share the good, and nothing is there for other people.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1830; Page No. 258

Verse: Teaching (your( knowledge every morning and night is better in the sight of God than Jihad (Holy war).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1831; Page No. 258

Verse: The basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God, is friendship with people, and benevolence to the good and bad of them.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1840; Page No. 259

Verse: The basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God, is friendship with people. Nobody is needless of consultation. The benevolent of the world will be the benevolent of the Hereafter, and the wrongdoers of this world will be the wrongdoers of the next.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1841; Page No. 259

Verse: The best (form of) abstinence is being pleased with one's (destined) sustenance, and the best thing for which to beseech the Exalted God, is the safety of this world and the next (to reach).
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1842; Page No. 259&260

Verse: The best act of worship in respect to (heavenly) rewards is to cut short your visit to patients.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1843; Page No. 260

Verse: The best action is (to have) pure intention.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1844; Page No. 260

Verse: The best action is moderation.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1845; Page No. 260

Verse: The best among my people are the hot-tempered who are quickly quieted down when they rouse to anger.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1846; Page No. 260

Verse: The best among my people are the learned, and the best of them are the forbear ant.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1847; Page No. 260

Verse: The best among my people are the learned, and the best of them are the merciful. Verily, the Exalted God will pardon a learned man for forty sins before pardoning an ignorant for a single one, and in the Day of Resurrection, the merciful learned will accompany their own light extending as stars from the east to the west.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1848; Page No. 260

Verse: The best believers are the content, and the worst the covetous.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 1849; Page No. 260

Verse: In the tradition recounting the Prophet (SAWA)'s Ascension to the Heavens (al-mi`araj): 'O Ahmad  be continuous in My remembrance.' The Prophet (SAWA) asked, 'O My Lord, how can I be continuous in Your remembrance?' He replied, 'Through seclusion from people, despising the sweet and the sour [of the world], and clearing your stomach and your house of the world.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 22, no. 6; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 782

Verse: Whoever loves something is engaged in remembrance of it
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 7851; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 782

Verse: There is nothing worse from amongst the transgressions than submitting to one's base desires, so do not obey them as they will preoccupy you from [remembering] Allah
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 7520; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 782

Verse: Anything that distracts you from the remembrance of Allah is classified as gambling
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 157, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 782

Verse: Anything that distracts you from the remembrance of Allah is from Iblis [Satan].
VerseRef: Tanbih al-Khawatir, v. 2, p. 170; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 782

Verse: Verily the most sufficient of riches is the intellect
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying 38; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 466

Verse: Verily filling the stomach, weakness of will, the intoxication of being fully satiated and the delusion of power, all hinder and delay one from the performance [of good deeds] and cause one to forget Allah.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 129, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 783

Verse: Whoever forgets Allah, Glory be to Him, Allah makes him forget himself and blinds his heart
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 8875; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 783

Verse: The angel only writes down what he hears, but when Allah, Mighty and Exalted, has said, "And remember your Lord within your heart ", no one knows the reward of that remembrance in the heart of the servant except Allah, most High.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 5, p. 322, no. 7; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 783

Verse: Repentance erases whatever precedes it.
VerseRef: Mustadrak al-Wasa`il, v. 12, p. 129, no. 13706; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 784

Verse: Repentance purifies the hearts and washes away the sins.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1355; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 784

Verse: There is nothing more beloved to Allah than a penitent believer   man or woman
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 7, p. 21, no. 15; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 784

Verse: Every son of Adam is a sinner, but the best of the sinners are the penitent ones
VerseRef: al-Durr al-Manthur, v. 1, p. 626; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 784

Verse: There are four signs to the penitent person: honesty in his work for the sake of Allah, avoiding misdeeds, adhering to what is right, and eagerness for what is good
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 20; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 785

Verse: They planted the trees of their sins before their eyes and hearts, and watered them with the water of remorse; thus they produced safety for them and left them with contentment and dignity.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 72, no. 38; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 785

Verse: Place us among those   who extinguish the fire of desires by shedding the water of repentance, and wash the plates of ignorance with the purity of the water of life
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 94, p. 127, no. 19; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 785

Verse: A man who is blessed with repentance will not be deprived of its acceptance, and a man who is blessed with seeking forgiveness will not be deprived of forgiveness
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 69, p. 410, no. 124; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 785

Verse: A man who repents before he sees [the angel of death], Allah will accept his repentance
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 440, no. 2 al-Kafi; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 786

Verse: When the soul reaches this   and pointed at the back of his throat   there will not remain a chance to repent for the knowledgeable man, but there will remain a chance for the ignorant one
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v.2, p.440 no. 3; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 786

Verse: Imam Ali ibn Mosa al-Rez? (a.s.), when he was asked about the reason for Allah's drowning the Pharaoh after he believed in Him and attested to His oneness, replied, 'Because he believed after he saw the wrath [of Allah], and belief at such a time is not accepted".
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 6, p. 23, no. 25; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 786

Verse: Remorse for a sin counts as seeking forgiveness.
VerseRef: Mustadrak al-Wasa`il, v. 12, p. 118, no. 13674; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 786

Verse: Remorse of the heart offsets the sin
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 23, p. 30, p. 46; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 786

Verse: A sinner who confesses to his sin is better than an obedient man who brags about his deed
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 6334; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 787

Verse: By Allah! None will be safe from his sin except the one who admits it.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 6, p. 36, no. 56; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 787

Verse: By Allah! Allah wants but two traits to be present in people: to acknowledge His favors so that He may increase them, and to confess their sins so that He may forgive them
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 426, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 787

Verse: Repentance stands on four pillars: remorse with the heart, asking for forgiveness with the tongue, work with the limbs, and resolve not to repeat [the offense].
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 81, no. 74; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 787

Verse: Wahab b. `Abdu Rabbih narrated on the authority of a shaykh from [the tribe of] Nakha`a, who said, 'I said to Abu Ja`afar (AS), 'I have been a governor since the time of al-Hajjaj until this very day - is repentance possible for me?' He remained silent. When I repeated the question, he said, 'No, until you compensate everyone for his lost rights.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 331, no. 3; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 787

Verse: Make a repentance for every sin; public [repentance] for public [sins] and private [repentance] for private [sins].
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 127, no. 33; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 788

Verse: Contentment is an unfailing wealth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 417; Page No. 63

Verse: Contorting one's tongue keeps man from wrong.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 418; Page No. 63

Verse: Control your tongue as well as your private parts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 419; Page No. 63

Verse: Control your tongue.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 420; Page No. 63

Verse: Cover your sexual organs in the presence of all but your wives and bonds women. It was asked: "What about relatives?" The Holy Prophet replied: "They should try not to see each other's sexual organs." "What if one of us be naked at his (her) own privacy?", He was asked. The Holy Prophet said: "One must be much more chaste to God than to people."
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 421; Page No. 63

Verse: Cover your thighs, for they're part of man's privy parts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 422; Page No. 63

Verse: Creating Adam in Paradise, the Exalted God left him on his own for sometime. Then, Satan began to move around watching him, and finally finding him empty- minded, he came to understand that Adam was not a self-possessed creature.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 423; Page No. 63&64

Verse: Creatures are God's and lands are His too, and whoever cultivates a piece of barren land, has a right to own it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 424; Page No. 64

Verse: Cunning and stingy people will not be allowed to Paradise.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 425; Page No. 64

Verse: Cure yourselves by cow milk. Verily, I hope that you can find in it divine recovery, for cows graze on all kinds of plants.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 426; Page No. 64

Verse: Cure yourselves, for He who has let diseases befall you, has created their medicines too.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 427; Page No. 64

Verse: Cure yourselves, O servants of the Exalted God! for he has created a (specific) medicine for any single kind of disease, save old age.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 428; Page No. 64

Verse: Cursing the one who remains thankless to the blessing bestowed on him will be effective.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 429; Page No. 64

Verse: David said: putting your arm up to the elbow in the mouth of a dragon to smash it to pieces is better than making a request to upstarts.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 435; Page No. 65

Verse: Death compared to its aftermath is like unto a goat's butting.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 436; Page No. 65&66

Verse: Death is a gift for believers.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 437; Page No. 66

Verse: Death is the expiation (of sins) for all Muslim men and women.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 438; Page No. 66

Verse: Death of a lonely person is martyrdom.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 439; Page No. 66

Verse: Debt causes day's abasement and night's grief.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 440; Page No. 66

Verse: Debt causes defect in one's faith and descent.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 441; Page No. 66

Verse: Debt defiles one's faith.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 442; Page No. 66

Verse: Debt is God's banner on earth, which He puts on the shoulder of the one he wishes to abase.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 443; Page No. 66

Verse: Restrain yourselves from other people' s women and your own women will remain chaste
VerseRef: al-Khisal, p. 55, no. 75; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 834

Verse: Most of my community who will enter the Fire will be as a result of two cavities the stomach and the private parts
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 79, no. 5; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 834

Verse: Verily Moses (AS) engaged himself for eight or ten years in restraining his private parts and his stomach
VerseRef: Sunan Ibn Maaja, no. 2444; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 834

Verse: Allah can be worshipped with no act better than restraint of the stomach and the private parts
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 79, no. 5; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 835

Verse: The root of self-restraint is contentment, and its fruit is fewer sorrows.
VerseRef: Masalib al-Sa' ul, p. 50; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 835

Verse: Satisfaction with one' s lot leads to self-restraint.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 1512; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 835

Verse: The worth of a man is proportionate to his ambition   and his chastity is in proportion with his sense of self-worth
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying 47; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 835

Verse: He who uses his intellect restrains himself
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 7646; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 835

Verse: As for self-restraint, from it branches out satisfaction, resignation, good fortune, comfort, a sense of evaluation, humbleness, a sense of remembrance, contemplation, magnanimity and generosity. These are the many ramifications for the intelligent man who practices self-restraint and is satisfied with Allah and with his share
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 17; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 836

Verse: "One who takes out full Zakat from his wealth and disburses it in the proper manner would not be questioned from where he gathered his wealth."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 77

Verse: Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) narrates from his father that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "Whenever Allah wants to offer something good to His slave He sends the angel who is the treasurer of Paradise to that person. That angel strokes the chest of that slave and he would get the virtue of paying Zakat."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 77

Verse: Amirul Momineen (a.s.) says in his will, "By Allah, be careful about Zakat because it silences the anger of your Lord."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 77

Verse: The narrator says that he heard Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) say, "Protect your wealth with the help of Zakat. Cure the sick among you with the help of Sadaqah. And no wealth is lost in land or sea except of the one who does not pay Zakat."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 77

Verse: "Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, forgives the sins committed during the month of Zilhajj, Muharram, Safar, Rabiul Awwal and first ten days of Rabius Sani by a pilgrim, his family, his relatives and by those for whom he seeks forgiveness."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 78

Verse: "Allah forgives one who performs Hajj for Allah's pleasure without the intention of showing it off to the people.
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 78

Verse: A person told Imam Zainul Abideen (a.s.), "You did not perform Jihad as it was difficult and performed Hajj as it is easy." Imam was resting his back against the wall. He sat up straight and said, "Woe be on you. The saying of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) at the time of the Last Hajj did not reach you. Surely, the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) conveyed to people through Bilal at sunset to keep quiet. When people fell silent, the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, "The Almighty Allah has made this day blessed for you. He has forgiven righteous among you and accepted their intercession for those who sinned. Go away for you are forgiven and you have gained the pleasure of Allah for those among you who were sinners."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 79

Verse: When the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) started moving towards Arafah, a Bedouin saw him in the desert and said, "O Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.)! I have come to perform Hajj but I am not able to do so because of some problem. I have wealth; tell me something, which I can do and gain the reward of performing Hajj." The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) pointed at Mount Abu Qubais and replied, "If you have a quantity of red gold equal to Mount Abu Qubais and you spend it in the way of Allah then too you won't get the reward of Hajj."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 79/80

Verse: An emigrant to God is the one who avoids what He has forbidden.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 201; Page No. 35

Verse: An evildoer who has hope in the Exalted God's Mercy is closer to Him than a disappointed pious.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 202; Page No. 35

Verse: An honest man should not be accustomed to cursing people.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 203; Page No. 35

Verse: An honest merchant will not suffer poverty.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 204; Page No. 35

Verse: An hour of seeking knowledge is better than praying one whole night, and a day of seeking knowledge is better than fasting three months.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 205; Page No. 35

Verse: An hour of standing in the line of holy war (jihad) for the cause of God is better than sixty years of worshiping.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 206; Page No. 35

Verse: An hour of thinking is better than sixty years of praying.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 207; Page No. 35

Verse: An ignorant man oppresses his companions, is cruel to his subjects, shows vanity against great men and speaks foolishly.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 208, Page No. 35

Verse: An ignorant worshipper is like unto a millstone ass.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 209; Page No. 36

Verse: An illegitimate child is worse than his/her parents, should (s)he commit adultery.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 210, Page No. 36

Verse: An oath depends on the intention of the oath-taker.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 211; Page No. 36

Verse: An old man can feel young for loving two things: long life and abundant wealth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 212; Page No. 36

Verse: An old man to his family is like unto a prophet to his people.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 213; Page No. 36

Verse: An old man's heart is young for two things: love of life and love of wealth.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 214; Page No. 36

Verse: An ugly fertile woman is better than a beautiful barren one, for I take pride in your greater population in respect to other nations.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 215, Page No. 36

Verse: And what disease is worse than miserliness?!
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 216; Page No. 36

Verse: Angels only make their presence in your wrestling and horse riding games.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 217; Page No. 36

Verse: Angels spread out their wings for the seekers of knowledge, for they are pleased with what they seek.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 218; Page No. 36

Verse: Anger belongs to Satan, Satan was created from fire, and fire can be put out by water. Thus, when one of you gets angry, (s)he should immerse in water.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 219; Page No. 37

Verse: Angles spread out their wings in satisfaction for whoever leaves his home in search of knowledge, until he returns.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 220; Page No. 37

Verse: Another preferable way is there besides going to extremes, i.e. being moderate in one's deeds.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 221; Page No. 37

Verse: Answering letters is as much a must as greeting someone back.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 222; Page No. 37

Verse: Any compromise is permissible among Muslims, save one by which the lawful is made unlawful and vice versa.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 223, Page No. 37

Verse: Any group of people among whom usury and bribery prevail will be respectively afflicted with famine and fear.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 224; Page No. 37

Verse: Apart from sincerity(in faith), you are not endowed with anything like safety.So, ask God for it.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah, Tradition No. 225, Page No. 37

Verse: Appointed to a job, be kind to and forgive your subordinates.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 226; Page No. 37

Verse: Appreciate God's blessings given to you, and let them not vanish, for a lost blessing will hardly be regained.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 227; Page No. 37&38

Verse: Sit in the mosque of Madina and give verdicts to the people, for I love to see the likes of you among my followers
VerseRef: Mustadrak al-Wasa`il, v. 17, p. 315, no. 21452; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 974

Verse: He who goes to visit his brother in faith at his home, without any motive on his part, is recorded as having visited Allah, and Allah honours His guest by His own right
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 192, no. 11; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 974

Verse: Visit each other for the sake of Allah, sit in each other's company for the sake of Allah, give for the sake of Allah and deny for the sake of Allah, keep away from the enemies of Allah and maintain relations with the friends of Allah
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, nos. 5392-5393; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 974

Verse: Pay visits to each other in your homes for verily that is a reinforcement of our teachings, and Allah has mercy on a servant who reinforces our teachings
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 2, p. 144, no. 6; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 974

Verse: He who is obedient to his parents and his Lord, will reside in the highest heaven.
VerseRef: Nahj al Fasahah; Tradition No. 874; Page No. 124

Verse: He who visits his brother for the sake of Allah and for His pleasure will be raised on the Day of Resurrection walking straddled by two cloths of light, and illuminating thereby anything that he passes
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 74, p. 347, no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 975

Verse: Visit each other for verily your visits revive your own hearts and act as a reminder of our traditions, and our traditions in turn awaken affection in you towards each other. If you adopt our traditions you shall be rightly guided and shall attain salvation, and if you abandon them you will stray and perish, so do adopt them and I will guarantee your salvation
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 5, p. 186, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 975

Verse: Nothing is more hurtful to Iblis [Satan] and his army than brothers in faith visiting each other for the sake of Allah.
VerseRef: al-Kafi, p. 188, no. 7; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 975

Verse: Visiting [each other] makes love grow [between you].
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 74, p. 355, no. 36; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 975

Verse: Meeting fellow brothers, even very briefly, causes the mind to broaden and develop.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, p. 353, no. 26; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 975

Verse: Visit people at regularly-spaced intervals for that will increase love [between you].
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, p. 355, no. 36; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: Visiting too often brings about boredom
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 237, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: When you are assured of your brother's love for you, then do not worry about when you will meet each other
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4087; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: Vitality is the most beneficial of bounties
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 973; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: There is no garment more beautiful than vitality.
VerseRef: al-Tawhid, v. 74, no. 27; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: Joie-de-vivre [i.e. the pleasure of living] is to be found through vitality
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4207; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 976

Verse: Vitality is a subtle bounty   when present it is forgotten, and when lost it is remembered
VerseRef: al-Faqih, v. 4, p. 406, no. 5878; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 977

Verse: He who sends peace and blessings on me once, Allah opens for me a door of vitality
VerseRef: Jami`a al-Akhbar, p. 152, no. 344; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 977

Verse: Vitality has ten parts, nine of which lie in silence except for the remembrance of Allah, and one part of which lies in abandoning the company of fools
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 89; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 977

Verse: Ask Allah for vitality, for verily after conviction no one is given anything better than vitality
VerseRef: Sunan Ibn Maaja, no. 3849; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 978

Verse: A man once heard the Prophet (SAWA) reciting the chapter [of the Qur' an] entitled al-Qari`aah (The Catastrophe) in his evening prayer, as a result of which he supplicated to be punished for his sins in this world and fell ill as a result. The Prophet (SAWA) said to him, 'You spoke badly indeed when you should have said, 'Our Lord, grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter and protect us from the punishment of the Fire!' and he supplicated for him until he got up again
VerseRef: al-Da`awat, p. 114, no. 261; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 978

Verse: Imam `Ali ibn Husayn (a.s.) bumped into the shoulder of a man circumambulating the ka`aba saying, 'O Allah verily I ask You for patience' , upon which the Imam said, 'You have asked to be tried! Say instead O Allah verily I ask You for vitality, and for the ability to thank You for my vitality
VerseRef: al-Da`awat, p. 114, no. 262; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 978

Verse: O Allah verily I ask You for vitality, and I ask You for gracious vitality, and I ask You for the ability to thank You for vitality, and I ask You for thankfulness for having granted me the ability to thank You for vitality
VerseRef: al-Da`awat, p. 84, no. 211; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 978

Verse: Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, has certain prot g s whom He tenaciously guards against tribulation, such that He gives them life through vitality, sustains them with vitality, causes them to die in vitality, resurrects them again in vitality, and makes them dwell in Paradise in vitality
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 462, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 979

Verse: Verily Allah loves the low voice and despises the raised voice
VerseRef: Munyat al-Murid, p. 213; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 979

Verse: O Abu Dharr, lower your voice at funerals, during a battle, and when the Qur'an is being recited
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 82; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 979

Verse: Three actions are considered to be gallant: lowering one's gaze, lowering one's voice and walking with deliberation
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 4660; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 979

Verse: Lowering one's voice, lowering one's gaze, and walking with deliberation are among the marks of one's faith and the integrity of one's devoutness.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 5073; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 980

Verse: There is no greater tribulation than your indifference towards your sins and your satisfaction with your current state of affairs.
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 286; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 864

Verse: Do not deem your petty sins as insignificant, for verily petty sins accumulate and become grave sins.
VerseRef: Amali al-Mufid, p. 157,no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 864

Verse: Petty sins lead the way for grave sins, and he who does not fear Allah with regard to small things will not fear Him when it comes to grave things
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 353, no. 55; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 864

Verse: Amir al-Mu'minin Imam 'Ali ibn Abi Talib (a.s.), when asked about the gravest of the grave sins, said, 'Feeling secure from Allah's plan, giving up all hope of Allah's munificence, and despairing of Allah's mercy
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, no. 4325; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 864

Verse: There are seven grave sins: intentionally killing a believer, falsely accusing a chaste woman of fornication, fleeing from the midst of a battle, returning to a state of renegation after belief [This includes apostasy as well as a mere return to one's previous state of heedlessness and complacency after having believed (ed.)], unjustly usurping the property of the orphan, devouring usury after knowledge of its prohibition, and everything else that Allah has threatened to requite with obligatory punishment in the Fire
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 277, no. 3; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 865

Verse: No petty sin remains when persisted upon, and no grave sin remains when repented for' [i.e. the petty sin can be cancelled with persistence and furtherance in it, hence becoming a grave sin, and the grave sin can be annulled with repentance].[
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 355, no. 62] ; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 865

Verse: Imam al-Baqir (AS) with reference to Allah's verse in the Qur'an: "those who do not knowingly persist in what they have committed", said, 'Persistence in sinning is when a person commits a sin, and does not seek forgiveness for it, and moreover, it does not even occur to him to repent for it   that is persistent sinning.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 6, p. 32, no. 40; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 865

Verse: Whoever takes pleasure in committing acts of disobedience to Allah, Allah will bring disgrace down upon him
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 8823; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 865

Verse: Beware of enjoying the sin, for verily that enjoyment is worse than the actual perpetration of it
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 159, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 865

Verse: The sin is also a [source of] misfortune for people other than the perpetrator, for if someone was to expose that sin, he too is afflicted, and if he was to talk about him behind his back, he is also committing a sin, and if he is content thereof and does not bother with others' actions, then it is as if he also partook in the sin
VerseRef: al-Firdaws, v. 2, p. 249, no. 3169; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 866

Verse: Tears only dry up and fail to flow as a result of hard-heartedness, and the hearts only harden as a result of an abundance of sins
VerseRef: Ellal al-Shara'ie, p. 81, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 866

Verse: The sins that prevent rain from falling are: the judges' unjust rulings, the giving of false testimony and the concealing of one's testimony.
VerseRef: Nur al-Thaqalayn, v. 5, p. 597, no. 24; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 866

Verse: When the rainfall is less from year to year, it is only because Allah sends it down as and when He wishes, such that when a people commit acts of disobedience to Him, Allah - Mighty and Exalted - withholds the rain that He had ordained for them
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 329, no. 12; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 866

Verse: There is no affliction worse than a lack of intellect.
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 286; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 466

Verse: When a man commits a sin, a black spot appears on his heart. If he repents, it is effaced, but if he continues committing it, the spot increases and grows until it engulfs the whole heart, and he can never again prosper
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, p. 327, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 866

Verse: Allah never bestows bounties on His servant only to take them away again until and unless he commits a sin, whereby he becomes deserving of Allah's deprivation
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, p. 339, no. 21; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 867

Verse: Indeed the servant commits a sin, and as a result he is deprived of the Night Prayer. And verily the evil deed pierces into and affects the one who committed it faster than a sharp knife can pierce into meat
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 272, no. 16; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 867

Verse: There are more people who die as a result of their sins than who die because they have reached their appointed time
VerseRef: Amali al-Tusi, p. 701, no. 1498; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 867

Verse: When the governors [of a place] are dishonest, rainfall is withheld [from that place], and when the sultan is unjust the whole country is abased, and when the alms-tax is not paid, livestock die as a result
VerseRef: Amali al-Mufid, p. 310, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 867

Verse: There are three sins whose punishment is hastened in the life of this world and is not delayed until the Hereafter: insolence to one's parents, intimidation of others and ingratitude for a favour
VerseRef: Amali al-Mufid, p. 237, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 867

Verse: The perpetrator of any of the following three misdeeds will not die before seeing their evil consequences in this world. They are: intimidation of others, cutting off one's blood relations and taking false oaths
VerseRef: Amali al-Mufid, p. 98, no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 868

Verse: There is a remedy for every ailment, and the remedy for sins is seeking forgiveness
VerseRef: Mustadrak al-Wasa`il, v. 5, p. 316, no. 5972; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 868

Verse: The believer is given seventy-two veils of which one is torn off every time he sins. When he repents however, Allah returns the veil to its original state and grants him seven more in addition
VerseRef: Nawadir al-R`awandi, no. 6; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 868

Verse: As long as a believing man or woman is in a state of physical, financial or domestic affliction when he dies, he meets Allah with a clean slate
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 67, p. 236, no. 54; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 868

Verse: No servant from amongst our followers (shi`aa) who commits an act that we have forbidden dies without first being afflicted with a severe calamity which expiates his sins, be it with regard to his wealth, his children or his own soul, such that he meets Allah with a clean slate. Moreover, if any of his sins remain even after that, then they are expiated by the pain and difficulty at the time of death.
VerseRef: al-Khisal, p. 235, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 869

Verse: When Allah wishes good for His servant, He hastens his punishment to the life of this world, and when he wishes bad for a servant, He suspends the punishment of his sins to face him on the Day of Resurrection
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 81, p. 177, no. 18; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 869

Verse: Illness wipes away sins.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 67, p. 244, no. 83; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 869

Verse: The fever of a single night is expiation for a whole year's sins
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 81, p. 186, no. 39; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 869

Verse: Verily Allah revealed to the world, 'Tire and wear out the one who serves you, and serve the one who rejects you.
VerseRef: Amali al-Saduq, p. 230, no. 9; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 998

Verse: The world is for the one who abandons it and the Hereafter is for the one who seeks it.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 81, no. 43; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 998

Verse: The example of this world is like your shadow for if you stand still, it stands still and if you chase it, it distances itself.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 9818; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 998

Verse: Do not insult the world for it is the best mount for the believer, because by means of it he attains good and through it he is saved from evil. If a servant [of Allah] says: "May Allah curse the world", the world replies: "May Allah curse the most disobedient one towards his Lord from among us!".
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 178, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 998

Verse: O you who insult the world, who have been deceived by its deceit and cheated by its falsities, do you covet the world and then insult it? Should you accuse it or should it accuse you? When did it bewilder it or deceive you?!  Verily the world is an abode of truth for he who is truthful to it, an abode of wellbeing for he who understands it, and an abode of riches for he who collects provision from it [for the next world].
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Saying.131; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 999

Verse: Beware of the world, for verily with regards to its lawful things there is accountability and with regards to its unlawful things there is punishment, its beginning is hardship and its end is annihilation.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 78, p. 23, no. 88; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1002

Verse: Beware of this deceptive and deceitful world that has been beautified by its ornaments and has seduced through its delusions  such that it has become like an unveiled bride upon whom everyone's eyes are gazing.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 73, p. 108, no. 109; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1002

Verse: Beware of the world, for verily it is deceptive, delusive and deceitful, it is a giver that deprives, and one who clothes yet leaves you naked.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Sermon 230; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1002

Verse: Beware of the world, for verily it is the enemy of the friends of Allah and the enemy of His enemies too. As for the friends of Allah, it fills them with grief and as for Allah's enemies, it deludes them.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Sa`ada, v. 3, p. 202; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1002

Verse: Verily the world is a house of deception and deceit, it takes a spouse everyday, kills a family every night and splits up a group every hour.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Sa`ada, v. 3, p. 174; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 1002

Verse: "I guarantee that one who leaves his house wearing a turban will remain safe from theft, drowning and burning (to death)."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 240

Verse: It is narrated that Imam Ja'far Sadiq (a.s.) asked a narrator, "Do you mention us in your gatherings?" He replied, "May I be sacrificed for you, yes." Imam said, "I like those gatherings in which our commands are enlivened. One who is discussing about us or if any of the people hearing him shed a tear equal to the size of the wing of a fly Allah will forgive his sins even if those sins are more than an ocean."
VerseRef: Sawab al-A`amal, Page 240/241

Verse: There are four people, the intensity of whose chastisement will also annoy the other people of Hell.There would be a man who had blissfully used abusive and foul language in the world. In Hell, puss and blood shall flow from his mouth
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 252,253

Verse: Whoever then acts aggressively against you, inflict injury on him according to the injury he has inflicted on you
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 253;

Verse: And whoever defends himself after his being oppressed these it is against whom there is no way (to blame).
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 253; Surah Shuara 42:41

Verse: And if you take your turn, then retaliate with the like of that with which you are afflicted.
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 253; Surah Nahl 16:126

Verse: From the two of them, the one who initiated it, is more unjust, his sin includes the sin of abusing as well as the sin of the one who had cursed him in reply. But the oppressed one should not exceed the limit
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 253

Verse: And the recompense to evil is punishment like it, but whoever forgives and amends, he shall have his reward from Allah, surely He does not love the unjust
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 254; Surah Shura 42:40

Verse: And it is nearer to righteousness that you should relinquish
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 254; Surah Baqarah 2:237

Verse: Jabir ibn Abdullah Ansari relates that Ali (a.s.) saw that a man was abusing Hazrat Qambar and Qambar was about to reply to him. Ali (a.s.) called him:
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 254; Safinatul Behaar

Verse: And not alike are the good and the evil. Repel (evil) with what is best. When lo! he between whom and you is enmity would be as if he were a warm friend. And none are made to receive it but those who are patient, and none are made to receive it but those who have mighty good fortune.
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 254; Surah Hamim 41:34-35

Verse: They ask you about intoxicants and the games of chance. Says: in both of them there is a great sin and means of profit for men, and their sin is greater than their profit
VerseRef: Greater Sins Vol 1, part 3, page 260; Surah Baqarah 2:219

Verse: Starving out is the best of remedies
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 903; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 771

Verse: Dieting from food causes no harm to the sick person.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 62, p. 140, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 771

Verse: [Starting to] Diet from food is of no benefit to the sick person after seven days
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 8, p. 291, no. 442; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 771

Verse: Diet control is the fountainhead of remedies and the stomach is the house of all ailments, so condition your body while it can be conditioned.
VerseRef: Makarim al- Akhlaq, v. 2, p. 180, no. 2468; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 771

Verse: Diet control is not to avoid eating absolutely anything, rather diet control is to eat lightly
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 8, p. 291, no. 443; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 772

Verse: In the soil of the grave of ?usayn (AS) is a healing for every disease, for it is the greatest remedy
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 101, p. 123, no. 18; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 772

Verse: It is possible for a medicine to be an ailment and an ailment to be a medicine.
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Letter 31; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 772

Verse: The pain of one who cannot bear the bitterness of a remedy will continue.
VerseRef: Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 772

Verse: Do not prescribe any remedy for a king, for if it benefits him, he will fail to show gratitude to you, and if it harms him he will accuse you
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 75, p. 382, no. 47; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 772

Verse: Never prefer anything above the remembrance of Allah for verily He says, "and the remembrance of Allah is surely greater."
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 77, p. 107, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 773

Verse: Remembrance is a source of great pleasure for the lovers [of Allah].
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 670; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 773

Verse: Remembrance is sitting in the company of the Beloved One.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 322; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 773

Verse: Remembrance of Allah is the natural disposition of every good-doer and the distinguishing mark of every believer
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 5173; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 773

Verse: I urge you to recite the Qur'an and remember Allah frequently, for verily it [will result in] a remembrance for you in the heavens and a light for you in the earth
VerseRef: al-Khisal, p. 525, no. 13; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 774

Verse: Whoever remembers Allah in private, has surely remembered Allah much.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 93, p. 342, no. 11; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 774
