VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3920; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 131

Verse: The bane of worship is showing-off.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3921; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 131

Verse: The bane of generosity is mentioning one's favors to others.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3923; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 131

Verse: The bane of religion is suspicion.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3924; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 131

Verse: The bane of the intellect is desire
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3925; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 131

Verse: The obstacles of fate are the bane of glory.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3922; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 132

Verse: The bane of the soul is infatuation with this world.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3926; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 132

Verse: The bane of counsel is the contradiction of opinions.'
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3927; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 132

Verse: The downfall of kings is bad conduct
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3928; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 132

Verse: The downfall of ministers is a corrupt heart.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 3929; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 132

Verse: The one who is overcome by negligence, his heart is dead.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 8430; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 633

Verse: Continued negligence blinds insight
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 5146; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 633

Verse: Beware of negligence and delusion about the respite [that you have been given], for indeed negligence ruins deeds.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 2717; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 634

Verse: Verily the man of intellect tolerates [others' ignorance] half of the time and feigns ignorance himself the other half.
VerseRef: Ghurar al-Hikam, no. 2378; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 634

Verse: [Fear] Allah and [keep] Allah in view in the matter of your neighbours, because they were the subject of your Prophet's advice. He continuously advised in their favour such that we thought he would allow them a share in inheritance
VerseRef: Nahj al-Balagha, Letter 47; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 635

Verse: Neighbourliness causes the lands to thrive and increases life spans
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 667, no. 8; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 635

Verse: Neighbourliness is not only to desist from annoying [one's neighbour], but also to forbear annoyance [from him].
VerseRef: Tuhaf al-`Uqoul, no. 409; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 635

Verse: Whoever believes in Allah and the Day of Resurrection must not annoy his neighbour
VerseRef: al-Kafi, v. 2, p. 667, no. 6; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 635

Verse: He is not of us whose neighbour is not safe from his troubles
VerseRef: Uyoun Akhbar al-Reza (AS), v. 2, p. 24, no. 2; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 635

Verse: The archangel Gabriel continuously advises me about standing for prayer in the night such that I really thought the good people in my community will never sleep
VerseRef: Amali al-Saduq, p. 349, no. 1; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 636

Verse: Allah has mercy on the man who wakes up in the night to pray, and wakes his wife so she too prays, and sprinkles water on her face if she refuses to get up. And Allah has mercy on the woman who wakes up in the night to pray, and wakes her husband to pray too, and sprinkles water on his face if he refuses to get up.
VerseRef: Sunan e Abi Dawood, p. 145; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 636

Verse: Verily when a servant withdraws to be alone with his Master in the middle of the dark night and intimately converses with Him, Allah places divine light into his heart then He, Exalted be His Splendour, says to His angels, 'O My angels, look at My servant how he seeks solitude to be with Me in the middle of the dark night while the worthless ones remain heedless and the negligent ones sleep. Witness that verily I have forgiven him
VerseRef: Amali al-Saduq, p. 230, no. 9; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 636

Verse: Standing to pray in the night is conducive to the health of the body, is a source of pleasure for the Lord, exposes one to [the descent of] divine mercy, and is adherence to the moral virtues of the prophets.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 87, p. 143, no. 17; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 637

Verse: I have never left the night prayer since I heard the Prophet (SAWA) say that the night prayer is a light.' Ibn al-Kawwa' asked, 'Not even on the night of al-Harir?' [al-Harir: a celebrated battle between two tribes (ed.)] to which he replied, 'Not even on the night of al-Harir
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 41, p. 17, no. 10; Mizan ul Hikmah, page No. 637

Verse:
Luqman, the wise, said:
My son! God revives the hearts of men with the light of knowledge as he revives dead lands with blessings of rains from the sky!
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, volume one

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said, The clement person is unknown until he is angered.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 74, p. 178, no. 21

Category: How to Arm Oneself Against Enemies
Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said in his advice to his son, O my son, let your weapons against your enemy with which you bring him to the ground be crafty persuasion and a [false] display of pleasure with him, and do not pursue him by running after him in case what you harbour within may become manifest to him leading him to prepare himself for you.
VerseRef: Amali al-Saduq, p. 532, no. 5

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said to his son, exhorting him, If you want to attract Honor in this world, then cut off your greed of drawing advantage from what other people have in their possession; for verily the prophets and the veracious ones achieved what they did by cutting off their greed.
VerseRef: Qasas al-Anbiya, p. 195, p. 244

Category: The Distinguishing Characteristics of a Negligent Person
Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said to his son, exhorting him: O my son, everything has a distinguishing characteristic by which it is recognised and witnessed  the negligent person has three distinguishing characteristics: absent-mindedness, amusement, and forgetfulness.
VerseRef: al-Khisal, p. 121, no. 113

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said to his son, exhorting him, Pray in congregation, even if you have to stand on an arrowhead [to do so].
VerseRef: al-Mahasin, v. 2, p. 126, no. 1348

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said to his son, exhorting him, O my son, if you are in doubt about death, then try to avert yourself from falling asleep and you will not be able to, and if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then try to avert yourself from waking up and you will not be able to do that either.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 7, p. 42, no. 13

Verse: Luqman (a.s.), said to his son, My son! Do not ever scorn anybody because of his ragged clothes, for verily your Lord and his Lord is the same One.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 72, p. 47, no. 57

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) in his advice to his son, said, O my son, do not let the rooster be smarter than you  it rises at dawn seeking forgiveness whilst you sleep!
VerseRef: Mustadrak al-Wasail, v. 12, p. 146, no. 13744

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said, O my son! Sit with the scholars and impose on them such that you sit knee to knee with them, for Allah, the Exalted, revives the hearts thereby with the light of wisdom like he revives the land with the heavy rain from the sky.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 1, p. 204, no. 22

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said, O my son! Return the trust in order to save your life in this world and in the hereafter; and be trustworthy in order to be prosperous.
VerseRef: Maani al-Akhbar, p. 253, no. 1

Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said [advising his son], My son, learn wisdom and you will become noble, for verily wisdom directs towards religion, it honours the slave with freedom, it raises the poor above the rich and it precedes the young over the old.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 13, p. 432, no. 24

Category: The Danger of Preferring the World [over the Hereafter]
Verse: Luqman (a.s.) said in counsel to his son, Sell your world for your Hereafter and you will attain both of them, but do not sell your Hereafter for your world for you will lose them both.
VerseRef: Bihar al-Anwar, v. 13, p. 422, no. 17

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: Husain (a.s.) is from me and I am from Husain (a.s.). Allah loves those who love Husain (a.s.). Husain (a.s.) is a chief from among the chiefs.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: On Judgment Day, I will intercede for one who comes to Medina for my Ziyarat, expecting divine rewards.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #14

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: On Judgment Day, I will intercede for one who comes to my Ziyarat.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: On Judgment Day, I will intercede for one who performs my Ziyarat.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: On Judgment Day, I will visit one who has performed my Ziyarat or the Ziyarat of anyone from my progeny; till I save him from the terrors of that day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: One who comes to the Ziyarat of my grave after my passing away is like one who has migrated to me during my lifetime. So if you cannot come for my Ziyarat, convey your salutation to me, for it is sure to reach me.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #17

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: One who enters my Masjid, that is Quba Masjid, and prays two Rakats prayer in it, will receive the reward of performing an Umrah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: One who performs my Ziyarat after my passing away is like one who visited me during my lifetime and I will be his witness and intercessor on Judgment Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #16

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: One who performs my Ziyarat during my lifetime or after my passing away will be in my neighborhood on Judgment Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) was seen with Imams Hasan and Husain (a.s.) sitting in his lap. He went on kissing Imam Hasan (a.s.) and Imam Husain (a.s.) and saying to him, "Woe on those who kill you."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Ali (a.s.) said: Euphrates is the chief of the water bodies in the world and Hereafter.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Ali (a.s.) said: Husain will be slain on the outskirts of Kufa. By Allah, as if I can see different wild animals stretching their necks on his grave, crying and weeping over him throughout night till daybreak. When this happens, beware of oppressing him (by not visiting his grave).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Ali (a.s.) said: Indeed Husain (a.s.) will be slain in a cruel manner. Indeed, I know the land on which he will be slain and I know that the land is near two streams.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said: May my parents be sacrificed on Husain, who will be slain on the outskirts of Kufa. By Allah, it is as if I can see different wild animals stretching their necks to his grave, crying and weeping over him throughout the night. When this happens, beware of forsaking his Ziyarat.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said: Water is the chief of the drinks of this world and Hereafter. Four rivers in this world are from Paradise: Euphrates, Nile, Saihan and Jaihan. Euphrates contains water, Nile contains honey, Saihan contains wine, and Jaihan, milk.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: I heard Amirul Momineen (a.s.) in Ruhba reciting this verse: "So the heaven and the earth did not weep for them, nor were they given respite." (44:29), when Husain (a.s.) entered from one of the doors of the Masjid. Amirul Momineen (a.s.) said, "Know that he [Husain], will soon be martyred and the heavens and the earth will weep over him."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #19

Verse: Imam Husain (a.s.) was asked, "Where did you bury Amirul Momineen (a.s.)?" He replied, "We carried him out during the night, passed the Masjid Ashath and then to the area behind Ghari."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Husain (a.s.) was never mentioned before Imam Sadiq (a.s.) during the day, but that he was not seen smiling until nightfall.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Abu Hamza Thumali said: Imam Sajjad (a.s.) left Medina with the sole purpose of visiting Kufa Masjid. He prayed two Rakats and then left. He mounted his camel and continued on his way.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sajjad (a.s.) said: Every night an angel descends and drops three pieces of musk from the musk of Paradise in Euphrates. There is no river more blessed than Euphrates anywhere in the east or west.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) asked, "What is the distance between you and the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" I (the narrator) replied, "One day of riding or over a day of walking." Imam (a.s.) asked, "Do you go to him once every week?" I replied, "No. I only go to him once in a while." Imam (a.s.) said, "How negligent you people are! Indeed if it was so near us, we would have relocated there."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) asked, "What is the distance between you and the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" I (the narrator) replied, "Sixteen Farsakhs." Imam (a.s.) asked, "Do you not visit him?" I replied, "No." Imam (a.s.) said, "How negligent you people are!"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said to a man: O so and so, what prevents you at times of need from going to the tomb of Imam Husain (a.s.), praying four Rakats and then asking Allah for you needs? Indeed, praying an obligatory prayer near his grave equals a Hajj and praying a Nafilah prayer, equals an Umrah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: Those who want to hold onto the "firmest handle (2:256) of Allah, which He has mentioned in Quran, should love Ali Ibne Abi Talib, Hasan and Husain (a.s.), for indeed the Almighty Allah loves them from His Throne.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Do not neglect prayers in Kufa Masjid even if you have to crawl to it, because a prayer there equals seventy prayers in other Masjids.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #13

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Four thousand disheveled angels, covered with dust cry over Imam Husain (a.s.) until Judgment Day. No one who comes to his Ziyarat but that they welcome him. No visitor of Imam Husain (a.s.) becomes ill, but that they visit them and none of them dies, but that they are present near him.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Humans, Jinns, birds and beasts; all shed tears on Husain bin Ali (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Husain bin Ali (a.s.) wrote a letter from Kerbala to Muhammad bin Hanafiyyah: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful. From Husain bin Ali to Muhammad bin Ali and those with him from Bani Hashim: As if this life never existed and the Hereafter has always been there. And peace (be on you).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #16

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: If people knew the excellence of Kufa Masjid, they would prepare to come to it from far off places. Praying an obligatory prayer there equals a Hajj, and praying a recommended prayer equals an Umrah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: If the distance between us and Euphrates was so and so, we would go to it to seek cure from its water.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Indeed Ziyarat of the grave of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) is equal to an accepted Hajj performed in the company of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #20

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Sins of one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on fifteenth Shaban will be forgiven and no sins will be recorded for him in that year. And if he performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) again on fifteenth Shaban the following year, the Almighty Allah will forgive all his sins.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Those of our Shia who dont perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) lack in faith and their belief is incomplete. And even if they enter Paradise, their position will be lower than that of believers.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: When Allahs Messenger passed by the graves of some believers, he would say, "Peace be on the dwellings of the believers. Insha Allah we shall join you."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #13

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) or Allahs Messenger or Uhad martyrs is equivalent to an accepted Hajj with Allahs Messenger.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) said: Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) or Allahs Messenger or Uhad martyrs is equivalent to an accepted Hajj with Allahs Messenger.Traditions 6 & 7: Same as no. 5.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Baqir (a.s.) stood at a grave and said: O Allah! Connect with him in his loneliness; keep company in his desolation; send down Your Mercy on him in a way that he will not need the mercy of others.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #14

Verse: I (the narrator) went to Imam Sadiq (a.s.) and recited an elegy on Imam Husain (a.s.). When I reached this verse: "What a great disaster! Instead of scattering dust over Imam Husain, he was rolled in dust!" A lady weeping behind the curtain, screamed, "Father!"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: I heard Imam Sadiq (a.s.) say: The heavens wept over Husain bin Ali (a.s.) and Yahya bin Zakariya (a.s.) and they have never wept over anyone other than them. I asked, "How was the weeping of the heavens?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "The heavens became red for forty days, like the sun at the time of sunrise and sunset." I asked, "Is that how the heavens weep?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #17

Verse: I heard Imam Sadiq (a.s.) say: There is no prophet in the heavens or earth who does not ask Allahs permission to perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.). Thus a crowd descends to perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and a crowd ascends back to the heavens.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam (a.s.) said: One should recite Surah Qadr on the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave to seal it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) asked, "Shahab, how many Hajjs have you performed?" I replied, "Nineteen." Imam (a.s.) said, "Complete the twentieth so that the reward of one Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is written for you."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) asked: Whats wrong with you? Why dont you go to him (to the grave of Imam Husain)? Because four thousand angels are present at his grave and they cry on him until Judgment Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) explained the following verse, "And when the female infant buried alive is asked for what sin she was killed," (81:8-9) by saying, "This verse was revealed about Husain bin Ali (a.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) explained the verse, "And We gave them a shelter on a lofty ground having meadows and springs." (23:50). He said, "meadows refers to Najaf of Kufa and "spring refers to Euphrates."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) explained the verse, "So the heaven and the earth did not weep for them, nor were they given respite." (44:29). "The heavens never wept over anyone after the killing of Yahya bin Zakariya (a.s.) until Imam Husain (a.s.) was slain. And when he was killed, the heavens wept once more."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said, "In the verse, "then there should be no hostility except against the oppressors. (2:193) "oppressors refers to the descendants of the killers of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said, "On Arafah eve, Allah, the blessed and exalted first looks at the visitor of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.)." I (narrator) asked, "Even before glancing at those who are in Arafat (Hajis)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes." I asked, "Why is it so?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Because there are persons of illegitimate birth among those who are in Arafat but no illegitimate one is there among visitors of Husain (a.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said, "Recite whatever you want before the grave of Imam Sajjad (a.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said, "There is a fixed reward for every act, except for shedding tears on us."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: A Muslim should not refrain from going to the Ziyarat of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave for longer than four years.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #15

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: A prayer in the Prophets mosque equals ten thousand prayers elsewhere.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: "On Judgment Day, visitors of Imam Husain (a.s.) will be given an excellence over others." I asked, "What is it?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "They will enter Paradise forty years before others; whereas others have to wait in the accounting process."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: "Shores in the right side of the valley" (28:30), which Allah has mentioned in Quran is Euphrates; "the blessed spot" (28:30) is Kerbala and "the tree" (28:30) is Muhammad (s.a.w.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: "Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) equals an Umrah and one is not permitted to omit it for more than four years."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: "Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is equal to a Hajj and an Umrah and this much reward." The narrator says that Imam (a.s.) opened and closed his arms thrice.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: After saluting the martyrs, return to the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) and face the grave and perform as many prayers as possible.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah has appointed four thousand disheveled angles, covered with dust, at the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) to cry on him from sunrise to midday. At midday they are replaced with another four thousand who cry over him till sunrise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah has appointed seventy thousand angels to the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) who are disheveled and covered with dust to cry over him until Judgment Day. They pray at his grave and each of their prayers equals a thousand prayers of human beings and the rewards of their prayers is for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #14

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will cure anyone who has an illness if he starts treating himself with the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave, except in case of a fatal illness.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will forgive all the past and future sins of one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on one of the three eves. I asked, "May I be sacrificed on you, what are the three eves?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Eve of Eidul fitr, eve of Eidul Adha and eve of fifteenth Shaban."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will include one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) with recognition of his rights, as one in Alaa Illiyyin (the highest position in Paradise). Traditions 4, 5 & 6: Same as no. 3.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #12

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will record a thousand good deeds and erase a thousand sins for every step taken by one who goes to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on foot. He will also increase his rank a thousand times for every step taken. Imam (a.s.) added: When you arrive at Euphrates, perform Ghusl, carry your shoes and walk barefoot like a humble servant. Once you arrive at the door of the holy shrine, say Allahu Akbar four times. Then perform prayers near his grave and ask Allah for your needs.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #18

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will record eighty accepted Hajjs for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will record the reward of a thousand Hajjs, a thousand Umrahs and fighting a thousand Jihads with a divine messenger for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Arafah Day with recognition of his rights. And Allah forgives one who goes to his Ziyarat on first Rajab.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah will record the reward of freeing a thousand slaves for a one who goes to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) cognizant of his rights and he is like one who gave a thousand saddled and bridled horses in the way of Allah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allah, the exalted offered our Wilayat to the inhabitants of different areas but no one accepted it except Kufians. There is a grave near it to which no aggrieved person goes and besides which he prays four Rakats prayers without Allah returning him pleased, with his needs fulfilled.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said, "One who hates Hasan and Husain (a.s.) will come on Judgment Day without any flesh on his or her face and will not get my intercession."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said, "Women are the pleasure of my eyes and Hasan and Husain (a.s.) are my two flowers."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Amirul Momineen (a.s.) looked at Imam Husain (a.s.) and said, "O tear of every believer!" Imam Husain (a.s.) asked, "Father, am I the tear of every believer?" Amirul Momineen (a.s.) replied, "Yes, my son,"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Anyone who sells the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave has sold and bought the flesh of Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Crying and Jaza (uneasiness) is detestable over any matter except over Imam Husain (a.s.). Indeed, one who cries and acts impatiently on Imam Husain (a.s.) will be rewarded.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Days spent in Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) are not counted as part of ones lifespan; and are not reduced from the time of ones death.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Do not forsake the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.). Do you not like to be of those for whom the angels pray?"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Eating any clay is unlawful like eating pork. If anyone eats any clay which leads to his death, I will not pray on him, except the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave, for indeed it contains the cure for every disease. But one who eats it to satisfy a craving, will not find any cure in it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Even if you go to Hajj every year but dont perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), you have abandoned one of your obligations towards Allah and His messenger, because the right of Imam Husain (a.s.) is made obligatory on every Muslim by the Almighty Allah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Everyday some drops fall from Paradise into Euphrates.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Four thousand angels came down to fight for Imam Husain (a.s.) but he did not permit them. When they came down again to seek permission, Imam Husain (a.s.) had already been martyred. So they remain at his grave, disheveled and covered with dust, crying over him until Judgment Day. Their leader is an angel called Mansur.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #15

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Giving a Dirham in charity in Kufa equals giving two hundred Dirhams elsewhere, and praying two Rakats in Kufa equals a hundred Rakats elsewhere.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: His Eminence, Husain bin Ali (a.s.) said to his companions on the day they were surrounded by calamities, "I bear witness that permission has been granted for you to be killed, so adopt piety and be patient."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: I have come to know that some people go to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain carrying different kinds of foods including sweet meats and other deserts. Indeed, if they had gone to visit the graves of their loved ones, they would not have done thus.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If a believer, who suffers from a illness and who believes in the rights of Imam Husain (a.s.) and in his sanctity and Wilayat, takes a little bit from the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave, he will be cured.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If Euphrates water is used to open the mouth of a newborn and is his first drink, he will be among those who love us, Ahle Bayt.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If one intends to go for Hajj, but does not have the means to do so and goes to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) instead and spends Arafah Day at his grave, his Ziyarat will be considered as equivalent to Hajj.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If one of you are far from us and there is a great distance between us, you should ascend to the highest place of your house, perform two Rakats prayers, point to our graves and recite salutations, for indeed they will reach us.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If one of you goes for Hajj a thousand times but does not perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), he has forsaken one of his divine obligations and he will be accountable for it on Judgment Day. Fulfilling ones obligation to Imam Husain (a.s.) is necessary and obligatory on every Muslim.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: If you are near him and it is possible to do Ghusl, do so; otherwise perform Wudhu and then do his Ziyarat.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Imam Hasan (a.s.) asked Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.), "Father, what is the reward for one who performs your Ziyarat?" The Prophet replied, "My son, on Judgment Day, it will be my divine obligation to visit one who performs my Ziyarat during my lifetime or after my passing away, or performs the Ziyarat of your father, and to save him from his sins."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Imam Husain (a.s.) said, "I am the martyrs of tears. I will be slain in anguish. Anyone who performs my Ziyarat in anguish would be eligible of being returned to his family with his heart pleased and satisfied."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Imam Husain (a.s.) was slain in grief and distress. So it is only fitting on Allah to return every aggrieved person who performs his Ziyarat, pleased.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Imam Husain said, "I am the martyrs of tears. No believer remembers me without weeping." Traditions 4, 5 & 6: Same as no. 3.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Indeed Fatima (s.a.), daughter of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.), visits one who performs the Ziyarat of the grave of her son, Imam Husain (a.s.) and seeks forgiveness for his sins.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: It is an obligation on wealthy to perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) twice a year and on the poor, once a year.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Limits of Masjid Sahla reach upto Rawha.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #9

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Make the first thing which is rubbed on the palate of your newborn children Imam Husains (a.s.) clay, for indeed it is protection.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: No Prophet or successor remains on earth for more than three days (after burial). Their souls, bones and flesh are taken up to the heavens. Hence, by going to places which contain their signs, or saluting them from afar, they hear it as if they were near.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On Arafah Day, Allah looks at the visitor of the grave of Husain and says, "Return with your past sins forgiven." Also no sins will be recorded for him for seventy days after he returns.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On Arafah Day, the Almighty Allah looks at the visitor of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) and says, "Continue with good deeds, for I have forgiven you." Then He attends to the people in Arafat.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On fifteenth Shaban, an announcer announces from the highest horizon: O visitors of Imam Husain (a.s.), return forgiven and your rewards will be given by Allah, your Lord and by Muhammad, your Prophet.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On Judgment Day, a visitor of Imam Husain (a.s.) will be able to intercede for a hundred sinful persons destined to Hell.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On Judgment Day, Allah the blessed and exalted, shows His mercy to the visitor of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) before he does for those who are in Arafat. He fulfills their needs, forgives their sins and accepts their intercession. Then He attends to those who are in Arafat and honors them similarly.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: On the night of Qadr, "Therein every wise affair is made distinct" (44:4), an announcer will announce from inside the Arsh, "Indeed Allah has forgiven everyone who came to the Ziyarat of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) on this night."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who desires to be served at tables of light on Judgment Day should perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who goes for the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and performs Wudhu and Ghusl with Euphrates water does not raise his foot or places it down without Allah recording a Hajj and an Umrah for him.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) in the month of Ramadan and dies on the way will not be judged, his scroll of deeds will not be published and he will be told, "Enter Paradise safely."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Ashura Day with recognition of his rights is like one who visits Allah on His Throne.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Ashura Day, is as if he has performed the Ziyarat of Allah atop His Arsh.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) seeking proximity to Allah, the Great and Mighty, will be accompanied by Jibraeel, Mikaeel and Israfeel until he returns home.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) with recognition of his rights is like one who has performed Hajj three times in the company of Allahs Messenger.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #16

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who thinks he is a Shia but does not perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) before his death, is not our Shia and even if he is of those who enter Paradise, he will be treated as a visitor of the folks of Paradise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who visits the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) with recognition of his rights is like one who performs Hajj a hundred times with Allahs Messenger.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who want to be in the neighborhood of the Prophet, Ali and Fatima, should not omit the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who wants to be able to look at Allah on Judgment Day and reduce his troubles and fear for that which is coming, should perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) more, because the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is the Ziyarat of Allahs Messenger. Traditions 2 & 3: Same as no. 1.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: One who weeps for Imam Husain (a.s.) when he is mentioned before him will be rewarded by Allah Himself, even if their tears are as small as the wing of a fly. And Allah will not be pleased with any reward for them lesser than Paradise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Order our Shia to perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), because it is obligatory on every believer who testifies that Husain (a.s.) is an Imam appointed by Allah, the Mighty and Sublime.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Paradise is confirmed for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Ashura Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and do not ignore him. Because he is the leader of youths of Paradise and the chief of martyrs.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) once a year.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #12

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Prayers should be performed besides the head of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Since the day Imam Husain (a.s.) was martyred, Allah has appointed seventy thousand angels who are disheveled and covered with dust; to invoke blessings on Imam Husain (a.s.) and pray for mercy on him as long as Allah wills, that is till the time of the Qaim (a.s.). Traditions 6, 7, 8 and 9: Same as no. 4.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Sins will be forgiven of one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on fifteenth Shaban for three consecutive years.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The Almighty Allah has appointed seventy thousand angels on the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.), who are disheveled, distressed and covered with dust who invoke blessings on him every day. They pray for his visitors saying: "Lord! These are visitors of Imam Husain (a.s.)! Do such and such for them."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The Almighty Allah prohibited Hell to scorch the face of anyone who sheds tears when we are mentioned in his presence.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The boundaries of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) are twenty cubits by twenty cubits and this site is a garden from Paradise"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave can be collected from up to a distance of seventy fathoms from the grave.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave can be collected from upto a radius of seventy fathoms from the grave.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave is a cure even if it is collected a mile away from the grave.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The clay of the tomb, where Imam Husain (a.s.) is buried, is a cure for every disease and a protection against any fear.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The cure for every disease is in the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave and it is the greatest medicine.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The deed loved most by the Almighty Allah, is Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and the best deed according to Allah is pleasing a believer. And the closest a man can be to the Almighty Allah, is when he weeps in prostration. Traditions 5 & 6: Same as no. 1.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The following is among the rulings in Allahs knowledge: that a traveler can pray in full in four locations: in Mecca, Medina, Masjid Kufa Masjid and tomb of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) is a garden from the gardens of Paradise since the day he was buried in it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The heavens turned red for a year when Imam Husain (a.s.) was slain; like it happened when Yahya bin Zakariya (a.s.) was slain. This redness is in fact the weeping of the heavens.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The sacred boundaries of Imam Husain (a.s.) grave are one Farsakh by one Farsakh by one Farsakh.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #9

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The sacred boundaries of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) are one Farsakh by one Farsakh from each of its four sides.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The sacred boundary of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) is five Farsakh from each of the four sides of the grave.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: The sins of whoever weeps, even as less as the wing of a mosquito, when we are mentioned before him will be forgiven, even if his sins are greater than the foam of the ocean.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There are two believing rivers and two disbelieving rivers. The two disbelieving rivers are Balkh and Tigris, and the two believing rivers are Nile and Euphrates. So open the mouth of your children with Euphrates water.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #16

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There is a cemetery near you called Buratha. A hundred and twenty martyrs, like the martyrs of Badr will be resurrected from it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There is a grave on the outskirts of Kufa to which no distressed person goes without Allah relieving him of his distress.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There is no angel in the heavens or earth who does not beg Allah for permission to go to the Ziyarat of the grave of Imam Husain. There is always a multitude descending (at Kerbala) and a crowd ascending (back to heavens).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There is no martyr but that he wishes to be with Imam Husain (a.s.), so that he can enter Paradise with him.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: There is no one but that on Judgment Day he will wish to be among the visitors of Imam Husain (a.s.), because they will see the way in which the visitor of Imam Husain (a.s.) is honored and treated by the Almighty Allah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Visitor of Imam Husain (a.s.) places his sins at the door of his house like a bridge and leaves them behind, crossing it in the same way as one leaves a bridge behind after crossing it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When Allah intends good for a person, He places the love of Husain (a.s.) and the love of his Ziyarat in his heart. When Allah intends evil for a person He places the hatred of Husain (a.s.) and the hatred of his Ziyarat in his heart.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When I was in Hirah with Abil Abbas, I used to go at night to the grave of Amirul Momineen (a.s.) located at the side of Ghari Noman towards Najaf. I prayed the Midnight Prayers at the grave and returned before sunrise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When you go the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), go to the part of Euphrates closest to his grave and perform Ghusl in it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When you go to the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.), recite: Peace be on you, O Abu Abdullah. Allahs curse be on those who killed you. Allahs curse be on those who took part in shedding your blood and on those who heard of your killing and were pleased with it. I seek proximity to Allah by remaining aloof from them.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #20

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When you intend to go to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), go while you are saddened, distressed, grief-stricken, disheveled, covered with dust, hungry and thirsty, for indeed Imam Husain (a.s.) was martyred while he was saddened, distressed, disheveled, covered with dust, hungry and thirsty. Then ask him for your needs and leave. Dont settle down there.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: When you intend to return from the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.), an announcer will announce to you. If you heard that call, you would stay there for the rest of your life. The announcer will say, "Glad tidings to you, O servant of Allah! Surely you have succeeded and you are safe. Surely your past sins have been forgiven. So continue with good deeds."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: You can pray the obligatory prayers in full in three locations: Masjidul Haram, Masjid of the Messenger and grave of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: You shall see two graves when you go to Ghari, a large and a small one. The large one is that of Amirul Momineen (a.s.) and the small one contains the head of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is equivalent to a Hajj and after one has performed obligatory Hajj, it is equivalent to a Hajj and an Umrah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) said: Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is equivalent to twenty Hajjs and even more.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) says: By Allah, the descendants of the killers of Imam Husain (a.s.) will be killed for the deeds of their ancestors.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) says: The killer of Yahya bin Zakariya (a.s.) was of illegitimate birth and the killer of Imam Husain (a.s.) was also of illegitimate birth. The sky has never wept on anyone but them. Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) said: There is a position in Hell that no one deserves, except the killer of Husain bin Ali (a.s.) and the killer of Yahya bin Zakariya (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked "Can I pray towards Qibla facing the grave?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Move to the side of the grave little." The man asked, "Can I take some clay from the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) and gain cure from it?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes or he said: no problem."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked about one who omits the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) for no reason. Imam (a.s.) said, "He will be from the folks of Hell."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked about praying in the holy sanctuary. Imam (a.s.) replied, "One should only perform obligatory prayers in short and he does not have to pray Nafilah." Tradition 4-5: Same as no. 1.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked about the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.). He (a.s.) said, "Go once a year, because I dont want you to be identified."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked about the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.). He replied, "Indeed, it is the best of deeds." Traditions 2 & 3: Same as no. 1.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked in Medina, "Where are the graves of the martyrs?" Imam (a.s.) replied: Is not the best martyr buried near you? I swear by One who has my life in His Hand, four thousand angels are present around the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.), disheveled, covered with dust and crying over him till Judgment Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "Can I take some clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave and keep it with me to seek blessings from it?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "No problem."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "How do some people who use the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave benefit from it while others dont?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "No, by Allah, except whom there is no god, anyone who uses it believing that he will benefit from it through Allah, will benefit from using it."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "How should I place my hand on the graves of believers?" Imam (a.s.) faced the Qibla, pointed towards the earth and then placed his hand on it.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "How should I salute the people of the grave?" Imam (a.s.) replied: Recite the following: Peace be on the people of the graves from the believers and Muslims. You have preceded us and we shall join you, Insha Allah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #9

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "How should we pray besides him when we perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.),?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Stand behind the grave near his shoulders and invoke blessings on the Prophet and on Imam Husain (a.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "How should we salute the folks of the graves?" Imam (a.s.) replied: Recite: Peace be on the people of the graves from among the men and women of the believers and the Muslims. You have preceded us and we shall join you if Allah wills.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #15

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "Is Ghusl obligatory before the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "No." Tradition 2 & 3: Same as no. 1.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "Is there an obligatory prayer after the Ziyarat of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "There are no obligatory prayers for Ziyarat." I (the narrator) asked, "How frequently should I go to his Ziyarat?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "As much as you like."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "O son of Allahs Messenger, should one perform the Ziyarat of your father [Imam Husain (a.s.)]?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes; and pray near his grave, but one should not pray before the grave, on the contrary stand behind it when praying."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "What is the reward for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) every month?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "He will earn the reward of a hundred thousand martyrs like the Badr martyrs."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "What is the reward of one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "He is like one who has performed the Ziyarat of Allah on His Throne." I asked, "What is the reward of one who performs the Ziyarat of anyone of you members of Ahle Bayt (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "He is like one who have performed the Ziyarat of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "What is the reward of one who performs the Ziyarat of the grave of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "He is like one who performs the Ziyarat of Allah on His Throne."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #21

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "When I perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.), can I pray to Qibla facing towards grave?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Move to the side of the grave a little."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.) was asked, "Who stopped Firon from killing Prophet Musa (a.s.) as mentioned in this verse: "Firon said, "Let me kill Musa (40:26)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Because Firon was of legitimate birth and only those of illegitimate birth and children of fornicator women can kill prophets and Divine Proofs."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: Imam Sadiq (a.s.), Imam Kazim and Imam Reza said: Allah will make one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Arafah Day to return with a satisfied heart.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: One of the Imams said: Four Umrahs equal a Hajj and Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) equals an Umrah.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #9

Verse: The Imams (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) on Ashura Day is like one who is smeared with his blood in his presence.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: The narrator asked Imam Sadiq (a.s.) how he should salute Imam Husain (a.s.). Imam (a.s.) replied: recite: Peace be on you, O Abu Abdullah. Peace be on you, O son of Allahs Messenger. Allahs curse be on those who killed you. Allahs curse be on those who helped against you and upon those who heard about your killing and were pleased with it. I seek proximity to Allah by remaining aloof from them.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #19

Verse: The narrator asked Imam Sadiq (a.s.) how to bid farewell to the grave of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.). Imam (a.s.) replied: Recite the following: Allahs blessing be on you. Peace be on you. May Allah not make this the last time I salute you.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: The narrator asked Imam Sadiq (a.s.), "Is praying in the Prophets mosque same as praying elsewhere in Medina?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "No. One ritual prayer in the Prophets mosque is equal to a thousand prayers elsewhere; but praying elsewhere in Medina is just like praying in any other city."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: The narrator says: I said to Imam Jafar Sadiq (a.s.): People narrate that those who go to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) will get the reward of a Hajj and an Umrah. The Imam said: By Allah, all the past and future sins will be forgiven of those who go for his Ziyarat, knowing his rights.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #15

Verse: When Imam Sadiq (a.s.) arrived in Hirah, he asked me (the narrator). "Do you perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)? I replied, "May I be sacrificed on you! Do you also go to his Ziyarat?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "How can I not go to his Ziyarat when Allah goes to his Ziyarat every Friday eve, with the angels, prophets, successors. And Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) is the best of the prophets and we are the best of the successors." I asked, "May I be sacrificed on you! Then should we also perform his Ziyarat on Friday eves, so that we can get the status of Ziyarat of the Lord?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes! O Safwan! Perform it, so that the reward of going to the Ziyarat of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) is written for you; it is such an honor."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: When Imam Sadiq (a.s.) entered a graveyard, he would say: "Peace be on folks of Paradise."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #18

Verse: Whenever Imam Husain (a.s.) was mentioned in the presence of Imam Sadiq (a.s.) during the day, he would not be seen smiling until nightfall. He (a.s.) used to say, "Imam Husain (a.s.) is the (cause of shedding) tear of every believer!"
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: I (the narrator) asked Imam Kazim (a.s.) if a person who is supposed to shorten obligatory prayers, pray near the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) in the holy sites and in the two Holy Sanctuaries. Imam replied: Yes, pray as many optional prayers as you can.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s) said, "I love for you that which I love for myself and I hate for you that which I hate for myself. Pray in full in the two sanctuaries, in Kufa Masjid and at the tomb of Imam Husain (a.s.)." Tradition 7, 8 & 9: Same as no. 4.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #6

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: Allah will forgive all past and future sins of one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) with recognition of his rights.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) held the hands of Hasan and Husain (a.s.) and said, "Those who love these two boys and love their father and mother will be with me in my station on Judgment Day.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #13

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: One who cannot come to our Ziyarat should visit our righteous followers and the reward for our Ziyarat will be recorded for him. And one who cannot do good to us should do good to our righteous followers and the reward for doing good to us will be recorded for him.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of this son of mine " Imam Reza (a.s.) " will be rewarded with Paradise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: The least reward for one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) by the banks of Euphrates, with recognition of his rights and believing in his sanctity and Wilayat, is that all of his past and future sins will be forgiven. Traditions 4-13: Same points mentioned in previous traditions.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #3

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) was asked, "Do the believers know who visits their graves?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes, and as long as they are besides them, they enjoy the company but as soon as they leave, they feel sudden loneliness."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Kazim (a.s.) was asked, "Should I pray in short or in full when I am in Masjidul Haram?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "You have the choice of praying in short but it is better you pray in full, because doing more good is always a blessing."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #10

Verse: One day when the children of Imam Kazim (a.s.) were gathered around him, Imam Reza (a.s.), who was young at the time, passed by him. Imam Kazim (a.s.) said: This son of mine will die lonely in a distant land. Indeed, one who performs his Ziyarat submitting to him and with recognition of his rights will be regarded by Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, as a martyr of Badr.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #5

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) said: A ritual prayer in Kufa Masjid has more value than seventy congregational prayers in any other Masjid.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #14

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) said: "Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) is equivalent to an Umrah."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) said: One who goes to the graves of their believer brothers, places his hands on the graves and recites Surah Qadr seven times, will be safe on the Day of Great Terror.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) said: Tell my Shia that coming to my Ziyarat equals a thousand Hajjs in the view of Allah. So Imam Jawad (a.s.) was asked, "A thousand Hajjs?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "By Allah, yes! And it is a million Hajjs for one who goes to his Ziyarat with recognition of his rights."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #9

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) sent me a bundle of clothes, in the middle of which was some clay. I asked the person who brought them about this clay. He said, "It is the clay of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave. Imam Reza (a.s.) never sends clothes or anything else to anyone without putting some of this clay within it and he says, "It is protection with the permission of Allah."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) was asked about the Ziyarat of Fatima, daughter of Imam Kazim (a.s.). Imam (a.s.) said, "One who goes to her Ziyarat will be rewarded with Paradise."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) was asked about the Ziyarat of Imam Kazim (a.s.). He (a.s.) replied, "Pray in the Masjids around the grave."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #4

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) was asked if the Ziyarat of Imam Kazim (a.s.) is same as the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.). Imam (a.s.) replied, "Yes."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) was asked, "In which month should we perform the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "On fifteenth Rajab and fifteenth Shaban."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: Imam Reza (a.s.) was asked, "Should I perform the Ziyarat of the grave of Imam Kazim (a.s.) in Baghdad?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "If you must, then perform the Ziyarat from behind the covers."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: The narrator took some dust from near head of Imam Husains (a.s.) grave. It was red clay. He took it to Imam Reza (a.s.) to show it to him. He held it, smelled it and began to cry. Then he said, "This is the dust of the grave of my grandfather."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Imam Jawad (a.s.) said: One who performs the Ziyarat of the grave of my father will be rewarded with Paradise.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #8

Verse: Imam Jawad (a.s.) was asked, "May I be sacrificed on you, is the Ziyarat of Imam Reza (a.s.) better or the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Ziyarat of my father (a.s.) is better, it is so, because everyone goes to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) but only our chosen and sincere Shia perform the Ziyarat of my father (a.s.)."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11

Verse: Imam Jawad (a.s.) was asked, "What is the reward for one who performs the Ziyarat of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) with sincerity?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "Allah will admit him to Paradise."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #15

Verse: Imam Jawad (a.s.) was asked, "What is the reward for the Ziyarat of Allahs Messenger with the sole intention of Ziyarat?" Imam (a.s.) replied, "It is Paradise and the reward for the Ziyarat of Imam Kazim (a.s.) is also same."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #7

Verse: When Imam Jawad (a.s.) was asked about the reward for one who performs the Ziyarat of Allahs Messenger (s.a.w.s.) solely for (the purpose of) Ziyarat, Imam (a.s.) replied, "Paradise." Tradition 3 & 4: Same as no. 2.
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #2

Verse: I went to Imam Hadi (a.s.) and he asked me, "Where are you coming from?" I replied, "I went to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.)." Imam (a.s.) said, "If you had gone to the Ziyarat of the grave of Abdil Azim who is buried near you, you would have been like one has gone to the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.).
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #1

Verse: I wrote to Imam Hadi (a.s.) inquiring about the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and Ziyarat of Imam Kazim and Imam Jawad (a.s.). Imam (a.s.) replied, "Imam Husain (a.s.) is foremost but the Ziyarat of Imam Kazim and Imam Jawad (a.s.) is more comprehensive and rewarding."
VerseRef: Kamil al-Ziyarat Hadith #11
